scheme_name: Assistance of Concentrate Feed for Pregnant Animals (Scheduled Tribe Category)
brief_description: This scheme provides free BIS type II concentrate feed to pregnant cattle owned by Scheduled Tribe Category livestock owners in Gujarat to ensure their good health, boost immunity, prevent metabolic diseases, and enhance milk production.
full_description: The scheme &quot;Assistance of Concentrate Feed for Pregnant Animals (Scheduled Caste Category)&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support Scheduled Tribe livestock owners during the last trimester of cattle pregnancy—a critical period for both the animal and the calf. Through this scheme, 150 kg of BIS Type II concentrate feed is provided free of cost to eligible beneficiaries to enhance milk yield, extend the milking period, and prevent health complications.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a livestock owner.
1. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe Category.
1. The animal/ cattle should be in the last trimester of pregnancy.
benefits: **Name of Component****Standard of assistance****Remarks****Minimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming Benefits**Concentrate Feed 250 kg BIS type II Concentrate feed per beneficiary100% assistanceEvery year

scheme_name: Establishment of Poultry Valley
brief_description: The scheme aims to promote sustainable and organized poultry farming among cooperative society members, especially women, by providing financial and technical support for poultry rearing, thereby enhancing income generation and livelihood opportunities in the state.
full_description: The scheme "Establishment of Poultry Valley" was introduced by the Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sustainable and organized poultry farming among cooperative society members, especially women, by providing financial and technical support for poultry rearing, thereby enhancing income generation and livelihood opportunities in the state.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant must be a member of a Multi-Purpose Agricultural Cooperative Society (MPACS).
1. Preference will be given to female beneficiaries under this scheme.
1. The applicant must not have any outstanding loans from MPACS or any other bank.
1. The selected applicant must be eligible to receive Medium-Term (MT) and Short-Term (ST) loans under the Deendayal Upadhyaya Krishi Kalyan Yojana.
1. The applicant must own or have land on lease.
benefits: Under the project, each farmer will rear 750 chicks annually in three phases. The Animal Husbandry Department will supply 500 one-day-old chicks from the state sector budget through M-PACS, while the farmer will bear the cost of the remaining 250 chicks.
The Cooperative Department will provide an interest-free loan for the construction of poultry sheds and for the care &amp; rearing of the chicks.

scheme_name: Gau Palan Yojana
brief_description: The scheme aims to promote cow rearing among eligible Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries, enhancing their livelihood and income generation by providing financial support for cow rearing units.
full_description: The scheme "Gau Palan Yojana" was introduced by the Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote cow rearing among eligible Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries, enhancing their livelihood and income generation by providing financial support for cow rearing units.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant must belong to the General, Scheduled Caste, or Scheduled Tribe category.
1. The applicant must be included in the SECC (Socio-Economic and Caste Census) category.
1. The applicant should have an interest in cow rearing.
benefits: Under this scheme, a milch cow up to the fourth stage of pregnancy is provided. Of the total cost of ₹40,000/-, 90% (₹36,000/-) is borne by the state government, while 10% (₹4,000/-) is to be contributed by the beneficiary.

scheme_name: Assistance in Packing Materials under Post Harvest Management of Horticultural Produce
brief_description: The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers to procure packing materials like corrugated and wooden boxes for post-harvest management of horticultural produce.
full_description: The scheme &quot;Assistance in Packing Materials under Post Harvest Management of Horticultural Produce&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat,  aims to support farmers by providing financial aid for packing materials used in post-harvest stages to maintain quality and reduce losses.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a farmer.
1.  The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
1. The applicant should be engaged in horticultural cultivation.
benefits: 1. **Unit Cost:** ₹10,000/ha.    1. 75% of the cost or ₹7,500/hectare, whichever is less.
<br>
> **Note:**
1. Corrugated boxes, wooden boxes will be used as packing material.
1. Assistance will be available up to a maximum limit of 1 hectare per account.
1. Available on i-Khedut portal every year (once during the year),

scheme_name: Assistance Program for Planting in Floriculture
brief_description: The scheme offers financial assistance to farmers in Gujarat for the cultivation of floriculture crops, including loose, cut, and tuberous flowers, based on crop type and farmer category.
full_description: The scheme &quot;Assistance Program for Planting in Floriculture&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to encourage floriculture in Gujarat by offering financial support to farmers cultivating various types of flowers. The assistance amount varies depending on the type of flower and whether the farmer is classified as a small/marginal or other category.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a farmer.
1. The applicant must be engaged in floriculture farming (loose, cut, or tuberous flowers).
benefits: > **Loose Flowers:**
₹16,000 per hectare or 40% of cost for small/ marginal farmers.
₹10,000 per hectare or 25% of cost for other farmers.
> **Stem (Cut) Flowers:**
₹40,000 per hectare or 40% of cost for small/ marginal farmers.
₹25,000 per hectare or 25% of cost for other farmers.
> **Tuberous Flowers:**
₹60,000/- per hectare or 40% of cost for small/ marginal farmers.
₹37,500/- per hectare or 25% of cost for other farmers.

scheme_name: Atma Nirbhar Plantation Yojana
brief_description: The scheme aims to promote self-reliance in the agriculture sector through sustainable plantation activities across the state. Under this scheme, support in the form of plantation assistance and allied resources is provided to individual farmers, Self-Help Groups & Farmer Producer Organizations.
full_description: The scheme &quot;Atma Nirbhar Plantation Yojana (ANPY)&quot; was launched by the Department of Agriculture, Government of Arunachal Pradesh, aims to promote self-reliance in the agriculture sector through sustainable plantation activities across the state&#39;s diverse agro-climatic zones. Under this scheme, support in the form of plantation assistance and allied resources is provided to individual farmers, Self-Help Groups (SHGs), and Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs).
eligibility: The Scheme can be applied by individual farmers as well as Self-Help Groups (SHGs)/ Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs).
**Eligibility Criteria for Individual Farmers**
1. The applicant should be a native of Arunachal Pradesh.
1. The applicant should be an individual farmer.
1. The applicant should have landholding between 0.50 hectares and 25 hectares.
1. The applicant should not be a bank defaulter.
1. The applicant should not be a government servant.
**Eligibility Criteria for Self-Help Groups (SHGs)**
1. The applicant should be a Self-Help Group (SHG) based in Arunachal Pradesh.
1. The SHG should have a minimum of 1.0 hectare and up to 50 hectares of land.
1. The SHG should not be a bank defaulter.
1. An already existing SHGs prior to involvement of SrLM shall be considered.
1. SHGs formed for small-scale industries such as weaving, knitting, tailoring, and other similar businesses shall not be entertained or considered eligible.
**Note:** The SHGs formed especially for Agri- sector shall be given priority.
**Eligibility Criteria for Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs)**
1. The Farmer Producer Organization (FPO) should be registered in Arunachal Pradesh.
1. The FPO should have a minimum of 5 hectares and a maximum of 50 hectares of land.
1. The FPO should have at least 100 shareholders.
1. The FPO should submit at least one audited Balance Sheet.
1. All board members and shareholders of FPO should be non-defaulters to any bank/financial institution.
1. All types of FPOs engaged in agriculture business will get benefit from this programme.
benefits: Access to plantation support including technical guidance, planting material, and financial assistance.

scheme_name: Krishak Utpadak Kshati Sahayata Yojana
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance and compensation to farmers in the event of loss or damage to crops, livestock, or agricultural land caused by fire, flood, or heavy rains in the notified areas of the state.
full_description: The scheme “Krishak Utpadak Kshati Sahayata Yojana” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Agricultural Production & Marketing Board under the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance and compensation to farmers in the event of loss or damage to crops, livestock, or agricultural land caused by fire, flood, or heavy rains in the notified areas of the state.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant must be a minimum of 18 years of age to submit and receive a claim.
benefits: Damage caused by fire accidents to standing crops, harvested crops in the field, crops stored in barns for threshing, or residual produce in the notified market areas of Uttarakhand State, as well as damage to property and livestock due to fire in the farmer’s house, and damage to agricultural land due to floods or rain-induced soil erosion, all such losses make farmers eligible to receive compensation under this scheme.

scheme_name: PMMSY: Ice Plant/Cold Store of Minimum 30-Ton Capacity - Haryana
brief_description: The subsidy for 30-ton capacity ice plants/cold storage units under Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) supports the establishment of ice plants or cold storage facilities with a minimum capacity of 30 tons to improve fish preservation and cold chain infrastructure in Haryana.
full_description: The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Ice Plant/Cold Store of minimum 30-ton capacity, introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide the subsidy to support the establishment of ice plants or cold storage facilities with a minimum capacity of 30 tons to strengthen fish preservation and cold chain infrastructure in Haryana. This centrally sponsored scheme is jointly funded 50% by the Central Government and 50% by the State Government. Beneficiaries must submit an undertaking in their DPR/SCP to keep the unit operational, bear all post-construction costs, and ensure ice is supplied to fishers and fish farmers at affordable prices.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Haryana and possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).

1. The applicant must submit an undertaking in the DPR/SCP to bear all operational, maintenance, and post-construction management costs, and to ensure the continuous operation of the ice plant/cold storage.
1. The applicant must note that central assistance will be provided based on the actual cost, within the overall ceiling specified under the relevant PMMSY sub-components.
1. The applicant must ensure that the ice produced is supplied to fishers and fish farmers at an affordable price.
1. The applicant must either own the project land or hold it on a long-term registered lease of at least 10 years to be eligible.
benefits: The project cost is ₹120,00,000/
> **Subsidy Distribution :**
1. A 40% subsidy is available for the General Category.
1. A 60% subsidy is offered for SC (Scheduled Caste) and Women beneficiaries.

scheme_name: PMMSY: Construction of New ponds for Saline /Alkaline areas-Haryana
brief_description: The scheme aims to expand fisheries in various urban and semi-urban areas. Through this scheme, subsidies for the construction of new ponds and central financial assistance for the initial fish crop on newly constructed ponds are provided to beneficiaries.
full_description: The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana: Construction of New Ponds for Saline/Alkaline Areas" by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Haryana, aims to expand fisheries in various urban and semi-urban areas. Through this scheme, subsidies for the construction of new ponds and central financial assistance for the initial fish crop on newly constructed ponds are provided to beneficiaries. The scheme considers ponds with a long duration and a registered lease period of at least 7 years for grants.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).

1. The construction of new ponds subsidy will be provided by the state government for the expansion of fisheries in various urban/semi-urban areas only under the construction of new ponds under the Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) scheme.
1. Only central financial assistance will be provided to the beneficiaries for the initial fish crop only on the fertiliser of newly constructed ponds.
1. Central financial assistance on the construction of new ponds will be provided only on ponds prepared for fisheries.
1. Under this scheme, ponds whose pond duration will be for a long time, and the registered lease period will be at least 7 years, will be considered for a grant on those ponds.
benefits: The project cost is ₹8,00,000/- per hectare.
The subsidy is limited to 40% of the project cost for the General Category and 60% of the project cost for Scheduled Caste (SC) and women beneficiaries.

scheme_name: PMMSY: Construction of Fish Kiosks Including Kiosks of Aquarium/Ornamental Fish-Haryana
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide central assistance for the construction of fish kiosks, including those for aquarium/ornamental fish.
full_description: The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana: Construction of Fish Kiosks including Kiosks of Aquarium/Ornamental fish" by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide central assistance for the construction of fish kiosks, including those for aquarium/ornamental fish.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).

1. The applicant should submit an undertaking in the Detailed Project Report (DPR)/Self Contained Proposal (SCP) to the effect that all operational, maintenance, and post-construction management costs of the infrastructure facilities shall be borne by them.
1. The applicant should ensure the fish kiosk will be kept in operational condition for 10 years.

1. The applicant should display a board permanently at the infrastructure facilities to the effect that the fish kiosk is constructed with Central Assistance under the Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY).
1. The applicant can only avail of central assistance for one unit.

1. The projects having land on long-term registered lease shall also be considered for Central financial assistance under the scheme. However, the lease period/ agreement shall not be less than a minimum period of 10 (ten) years.
benefits: The project cost is ₹10,00,000/- per unit. Subsidy of 40% of the project cost for General Category beneficiaries. Subsidy of 60% of the project cost for SC/Women beneficiaries.

scheme_name: PMMSY: Inputs for fresh water Aquaculture including Composite fish culture, Scampi, Pangasius, Tilapia etc - Haryana
brief_description: The scheme under Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) provides input cost subsidy for freshwater aquaculture in newly constructed ponds to expand fisheries production in Haryana.
full_description: The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Inputs for fresh water Aquaculture, including Composite fish culture, Scampi, Pangasius, Tilapia, etc, introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to expand fisheries production in Haryana. This centrally sponsored scheme is jointly funded 50% by the Central Government and 50% by the State Government. It provides input cost subsidies for the first crop in newly constructed ponds under PMMSY, aiming to promote aquaculture in urban and semi-urban areas.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Haryana with a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
1. The applicant will be eligible for input cost subsidy provided by the State Government only for the expansion of fisheries in urban or semi-urban areas under the construction of new ponds.
1. The applicant will receive central financial assistance only for the initial fish crop (fertilizer) in newly constructed ponds.
1. The applicant will be eligible for central financial assistance on input costs only if the pond is properly prepared for fisheries.
1. The applicant may use land on a long-term registered lease, provided the lease period is at least 7 years, for eligibility under this scheme.
benefits: The project cost is: 4,00,000/- per hectare
> **Subsidy Distribution:**
1. 40% of the project cost for General Category beneficiaries
1. 60% of the project cost for SC/Women beneficiaries

scheme_name: PMMSY: Construction of New Grow Out Ponds - Haryana
brief_description: The scheme aims to expand fisheries in various urban and semi-urban areas through the construction of new grow-out ponds. Through this scheme, subsidies are provided for the construction of new grow-out ponds to beneficiaries who are engaged in fisheries.
full_description: The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana: Construction of New Grow out Ponds" by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to expand fisheries in various urban and semi-urban areas through the construction of new grow-out ponds. Through this scheme, subsidies are provided for the construction of new grow-out ponds to beneficiaries who are engaged in fisheries.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).

1. The construction of new grow-out ponds subsidy will be provided by the State Government for the expansion of fisheries in various urban/semi-urban areas only under the construction of new grow-out ponds under the Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) scheme.
1. Central financial assistance for the construction of new grow-out ponds will be provided only for the ponds prepared for fisheries.
1. The applicant should have own land with clear title or having land on a long-term registered lease, not less than a minimum of 7 years.
benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance for the Construction of the New Grow-out Ponds. The project cost is ₹7,00,000/- per Hectare.
The subsidy will be limited to 40% of the project cost for beneficiaries falling under the General Category.
The subsidy will be limited to 60% of the project cost for beneficiaries who are Scheduled Caste (SC) or Women.

scheme_name: Scheme for the Welfare of Schedule Caste Families in Fisheries Sector: Subsidy on 2nd Year to 5th Year Lease Money
brief_description: The objective of the scheme is to provide full-time employment to individuals from Scheduled Caste families in the fisheries sector and uplift their economic status by promoting fish farming through financial assistance for leasing Panchayati ponds or watershed areas.
full_description: The “Subsidy on 2nd Year to 5th Year Lease Money” is a scheme component under the Scheme for the Welfare of Scheduled Caste Families in the Fisheries Sector, launched by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. The objective of the scheme is to provide full-time employment to individuals from Scheduled Caste families in the fisheries sector and uplift their economic status by promoting fish farming through financial assistance for leasing Panchayati ponds or watershed areas. Under this scheme, a subsidy is provided to Scheduled Caste beneficiaries to partially cover the lease amount for Panchayati ponds or watershed areas from the second year to the fifth year, thereby reducing long-term operational costs and facilitating the continuation of pond lease arrangements.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
1. The applicant should have a valid Family ID Card (Parivar Pehchan Patra).
1. The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Caste category.
1. The applicant's age should be 18 years or above.
1. Subsidy will be provided on lease money from 2nd to 5th year of lease.
1. The maximum area eligible for subsidy is 4 hectares per applicant.
1. The subsidy is applicable only on Panchayati ponds and government water sheds.
benefits: **Financial Assistance:**
40% of the actual lease amount OR ₹40,000/- per hectare, whichever is less.
The subsidy is applicable for a maximum of 4 hectares per beneficiary.
**Note:**  Subsidy will be provided on lease money from 2nd to 5th year of lease.
exclusions: The applicant must not be a Government/ Semi-Government employee.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland): Small Biofloc Establishment Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme aims to increase inland fish production and generate employment through innovative fish farming techniques like Biofloc and RAS.
full_description:
The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland)" with a component of Small Biofloc Establishment (7 tanks 4mm diameter and 1.5m height) introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to people involved in inland fisheries activities. Through this scheme, inland fish farming is promoted using advanced technologies such as Biofloc and Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS) to maximise fish production in less land and water. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries of the State Governments, with 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% from the Government of Gujarat.
> **Objective:** - Assistance is provided for accelerating inland fish farming activities in freshwater bodies, increasing inland fish production and boosting inland fisheries. - Except for water bodies or ponds, in less land, less water, Biofloc with source as well, Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS). By creating fish tanks with this method, more fish production can be obtained in less land and less water. If more beneficiaries get the benefit of the subsidy of this scheme, more fish production can be achieved with less water sources and less land. - Inland fish production capacity can be increased by the establishment of freshwater hatcheries.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be an individual, society, self-help group, association, reservoir lease holder, or private entity involved in inland fisheries activities.
1. The applicant must be above 18 years of age.
1. The applicant must have their own bank account.

1. The applicant must have their own private land or a minimum 10-year lease agreement for land to avail construction-related assistance on land. In case of co-owners, the consent form of co-owners must be submitted.
1. The applicant must have a Voter ID/Ration Card/Aadhar Card/Passport as proof of identity.
> **Preference/Priority/Reservation/Relaxation:**
All categories (General, Women, Scheduled Caste, and Scheduled Tribe) will receive benefits under the Inland Schemes.
Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries are required to have a Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe certificate to avail benefits under the inland components.
benefits: Small Biofloc Establishment (7 tanks 4mm diameter and 1.5m height):
> **Financial Assistance:**
The unit cost is ₹7,50,000/- per unit.
General Category: 40% of the unit cost or 40% of the actual cost, whichever is less.
Women/Scheduled Caste (S.C.) and Scheduled Tribe (S.T.) Categories: 60% of the unit cost or 40% of the actual cost, whichever is less.
> **Mode of Disbursement:** Assistance is paid through 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% contribution from State Governments.
> **Validity:** The benefit for small biofloc establishment can be reclaimed once in a lifetime.

scheme_name: National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture - Reinforced Area Development
brief_description: The scheme "National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture - Reinforced Area Development" aims to promote sustainable agriculture through improved agronomic practices, efficient resource use, and integrated farming systems by providing financial support to all farmers.
full_description: The scheme "National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture - Reinforced Area Development" is a centrally sponsored scheme that aims to promote location-specific sustainable agriculture production by encouraging improved agronomic practices, soil health management, better rainwater utilization, judicious use of agrochemicals, crop diversification, and the progressive adoption of integrated farming systems involving crops, livestock, and trees.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.
The applicant should be a farmer.
benefits: **Financial Help:** Provides financial assistance to eligible farmers to adopt sustainable agricultural practices.  - **Improved Agronomic Practices:** Encourages the implementation of location-specific, modern, and efficient farming techniques.  - **Soil Health Management:** Supports initiatives for maintaining and enhancing soil fertility and health.  - **Enhanced Rainwater Use Efficiency:** Promotes techniques and infrastructure for optimal utilization of rainwater in agriculture.  - **Judicious Use of Chemicals:** Advocates for reduced and responsible application of chemical fertilizers and pesticides.  - **Crop Diversification:** Encourages farmers to cultivate a variety of crops, promoting resilience and better income opportunities.  - **Integrated Farming Systems:** Supports the adoption of integrated crop-livestock-tree farming for holistic farm management.

scheme_name: Scheme for Fruit and Vegetable Preservation and Training Program in Horticulture Department HRT 5
brief_description: The "Scheme for Fruit and Vegetable Preservation and Training Program in Horticulture Department HRT 5" aims to enhance the skills of women through training on value addition, preservation, and kitchen gardening of horticultural produce, while also providing a daily stipend and training support.
full_description: The "Scheme for Fruit and Vegetable Preservation and Training Program in Horticulture Department HRT 5" by the Agriculture and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to empower women and urban citizens by offering hands-on training in value addition, preservation, canning, and kitchen-gardening of fruits and vegetables, along with promoting self-sustenance and nutritional well-being. The scheme includes financial support of ₹500/- per trainee per day- ₹250/- as a direct stipend and the remaining ₹250/- towards training material, expert honorarium, and other resources.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.
The applicant should be willing to participate in horticulture-related skill development training.
benefits: **Stipend:** ₹500/- per trainee per day sanctioned as training expenditure. Out of this, ₹250/- is provided as a direct stipend to the trainee, and ₹250/- is utilized for material cost, training literature kit, and honorarium to resource persons.  - **Skill Development Training:** Training duration ranges from 2 to 5 days. Modules include fruit and vegetable preservation, canning, kitchen gardening, and value addition.
<br>

scheme_name: Assistance for Protected Cultivation
brief_description: The scheme “Assistance for Protected Cultivation” by the Agriculture and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote protected horticulture practices by providing financial assistance to farmers for mulching, plug nursery, polyhouse, shed net house, and nursery development.
full_description: The scheme “Assistance for Protected Cultivation” by the Agriculture and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote modern, climate-resilient horticulture practices by providing financial support for protected cultivation infrastructure like mulching, nursery development, and plug nurseries. The scheme encourages self-employment and sustainable income generation for farmers through the use of polyhouses, shed net houses, and starter kits to improve crop productivity and resource efficiency.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.
1. The applicant should be a farmer.
benefits: > **Plastic Cover (Mulching):**
**General Area:** ₹32,000/- per hectare.  - **Hilly Area:** ₹36,800/- per hectare.  - 50% of the expenditure incurred, limited to 1 hectare per beneficiary.
**Self-Employment Oriented Horticulture Nursery Development Programme:**
**Nursery Structure:** ₹3,50,000/- per unit   - ₹3,00,000/- per unit for 500 sq.m. area
**Starter Kit:** ₹50,000/- per unit  - Assistance up to 65% of the cost or ₹2,27,500/-, whichever is less.
> **Shed Net House & Polyhouse:**
**Coverage:** 500 sq.m to 4,000 sq.m  - Assistance as per square meter cost based on empanelled company prices
Structures supported: Cylindrical, bamboo, and wooden.
> **Plug Nursery:**
**Public sector:** ₹30,00,000/- per hectare for 1 hectare  - **Private sector:** Assistance of 50% or ₹15,00,000/- per hectare (whichever is less) for 1 hectare.

scheme_name: Distribution of Seeds of more productions varieties/ Hybrids varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area: Agricultural Fair/Exhibition/Farmer Camp Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme aims to improve the agricultural productivity and the livelihood of Adivasi farmers. It provides hybrid seeds, fertilizers, equipment, and support for agricultural fairs.
full_description: The scheme "Distribution of Seeds of more productive varieties / Hybrid varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area (TASP)" with a component "Agricultural Fair/Exhibition/Farmer Camp" is introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide subsidized agricultural inputs to enhance productivity and livelihood of tribal farmers. Farmers belonging to scheduled tribes and tribal cultivators residing outside tribal areas can achieve higher production of agricultural crops and improve their livelihood by using plant protection equipment, tarpaulins, field demonstrations, micronutrients, agriculture fairs, water carrying pipelines, castor cake/neem cake/LFOM/green manure, pump sets, 100% water-soluble fertilizer, plant protection pesticides, etc. These tools and practices, when used according to scientific recommendations, can significantly increase crop production and, consequently, improve their livelihood.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Tribe.
1. The applicant should be a farmer.
1. The applicant should be located in tribal areas OR be a tribal cultivator residing outside tribal areas.
1. The scheme excludes farmers from Dang district.
benefits: The assistance is provided with a limit of ₹1,00,000/- can be spent for holding Agricultural Fair/Exhibition at the Taluka level. Farmer Shibir for 100 farmers, ₹15000/- can be spent within the limit.
> **Remarks:** Literature, tea, refreshments, meals, traveling expenses, exhibition stall fee, mandap, banner, photographs, sound system, electricity, furniture rent, Vs. Can be spent on things.

scheme_name: National Mission on Edible Oil- Oil Palm: Replanting of Old Oil Palm Garden
brief_description: The scheme component "Replanting of Old Oil Palm Garden" launched under the "National Mission on Edible Oil–Oil Palm" scheme aims to enhance oil palm production and lower dependency on imports by supporting farmers in uprooting and replanting old oil palm gardens.
full_description: The scheme component "Replanting of Old Oil Palm Garden" launched under the "National Mission on Edible Oil–Oil Palm" scheme by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation, Government of Gujarat, aims to enhance oil palm production and lower dependency on imports by supporting farmers in uprooting and replanting old oil palm gardens that have reached the age of 25–30 years. The scheme provides a subsidy of ₹250 per plant for uprooting, replacing, and digging new pits, thereby ensuring sustainable cultivation practices and long-term productivity.
eligibility: The applicant should be a farmer.
The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.
benefits: **Subsidy:** ₹250/- per plant (uprooting, replacing, and digging of new pit).

scheme_name: Distribution of Seeds of more productions varieties/ Hybrids varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area: Pump Set (TASP & OTASP) Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme aims to improve agricultural productivity and livelihood. It provides subsidized pump sets and farm inputs to Scheduled Tribe farmers (except Dang district).
full_description: The scheme "Distribution of Seeds of more productive varieties / Hybrid varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area (TASP)" with a component "Pump set (TASP & OTASP)" is introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide subsidized agricultural inputs to enhance productivity and livelihood of tribal farmers. Farmers belonging to scheduled tribes and tribal cultivators residing outside tribal areas can achieve higher production of agricultural crops and improve their livelihood by using plant protection equipment, tarpaulins, field demonstrations, micronutrients, agriculture fairs, water carrying pipelines, castor cake/neem cake/LFOM/green manure, pump sets, 100% water-soluble fertilizer, plant protection pesticides, etc. These tools and practices, when used according to scientific recommendations, can significantly increase crop production and, consequently, improve their livelihood.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Tribe.
1. The applicant should be a farmer.
1. The applicant should be located in tribal areas OR be a tribal cultivator residing outside tribal areas.
1. The scheme excludes farmers from Dang district.
benefits: > **Subsidy on oil engines:**

**3.0 to 3.5 H.Pa.:** 75% of purchase price or ₹8,700/- (whichever is less).- **5.0 H.Pa.:** 75% of purchase price or ₹12,000/- (whichever is less).- **7.5 to 8.0 H.Pa.:** 75% of purchase price or ₹13,500/- (whichever is less).- **10.0 H.Pa.:** 75% of purchase price or ₹13,875/- (whichever is less).
> **Subsidy on electric motors:**

**1.0 to 3.0 H.P.:** 75% of purchase price or ₹8,600/- (whichever is less).- **5.0 H.Pa.:** 75% of purchase price or ₹9,750/- (whichever is less).- **7.5 H.Pa.:** 75% of purchase price or ₹12,900/- (whichever is less).
> **Subsidy on submersible pump sets:**

**3.0 H.Pa.:** 75% of purchase price or ₹15,750/- (whichever is less).- **5.0 H.Pa.:** 75% of purchase price or ₹22,350/- (whichever is less).- **7.5 H.Pa.:** 75% of purchase price or ₹27,975/- (whichever is less).- **10.0 H.Pa.:** 75% of purchase price or ₹33,525/- (whichever is less).
> **Frequency of Disbursement:** The benefit can be availed once every 5 years.
> **Remark:** As per conditions No. 5, 16, 17, 19 and 22 of [Appendix-1](https://mariyojana.gujarat.gov.in/Schemeatoz.aspx). (Refer Scheme No. 35)

scheme_name: Distribution of Seeds of more productions varieties/ Hybrids varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area: Power Operated Plant Protection Equipment Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme aims to help farmers belonging to scheduled tribes and tribal cultivators residing outside tribal areas achieve higher production of agricultural crops and improve their livelihood.
full_description: The scheme "Distribution of Seeds of more productive varieties / Hybrid varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc., to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area (TASP)" with a component "Power Operated Plant Protection Equipment" is introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to help farmers belonging to scheduled tribes and tribal cultivators residing outside tribal areas achieve higher production of agricultural crops and improve their livelihood. Through this scheme, subsidies are provided on seeds of more productive/hybrid varieties, plant protection equipment, and agricultural inputs to the intended beneficiaries. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Tribe.
1. The applicant should be a farmer.
1. The applicant should be located in tribal areas OR be a tribal cultivator residing outside tribal areas.
1. The scheme excludes farmers from Dang district.
benefits: 1. The assistance provided is 75% of the purchase price of power/machine-driven equipment or ₹ 4500/- whichever is less. (Maximum one unit per account is allowed.)
> Remark: As per conditions No. 5, 16, 17, 19 and 22 of [Appendix-1](https://mariyojana.gujarat.gov.in/Schemeatoz.aspx). (Refer Scheme No. 35)
> Frequency: Once in 3 Years.

scheme_name: National Mission on Edible Oil- Oil Palm: Harvesting Tools
brief_description: The scheme component "Harvesting Tools" launched under the "National Mission on Edible Oil–Oil Palm" scheme aims to increase the production of oil palm and reduce its import by providing subsidies for various harvesting tools to farmers in the state.
full_description: The scheme component "Harvesting Tools" launched under the "National Mission on Edible Oil–Oil Palm" scheme by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote oil palm cultivation by increasing production in the state and reducing dependency on imported oil palm. The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers for purchasing harvesting tools and equipment required for efficient oil palm cultivation.
eligibility: The applicant should be a farmer.
The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.
benefits: **Cutter:** ₹2,500/- per unit.- **Wire Mesh:** ₹20,000/- per unit.- **Motorized Chisel:** ₹15,000/- per unit.- **Portable Ladder/Polls:** ₹5,000/- per unit.- **Chaff Cutter:** ₹50,000/- per unit.- **Tractor Trolley:** ₹2,00,000/- per unit.

scheme_name: To Increase Fish Seed Production And Inland Fisheries Equipment In Tribal Areas: Training Kit Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide training and equipment to boost inland fisheries among Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries.
full_description:
The scheme "To Increase Fish Seed Production And Inland Fisheries Equipment In Tribal Areas" with a component of "Training Kit", introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to increase fish production and provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Tribe (ST) fishermen by enhancing their skills and access to equipment. Through this scheme, training kits containing fishing and net-weaving equipment are provided to Scheduled Tribe trainees upon completion of training. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries.
> **Objectives:** - To increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to people involved in inland fisheries activities. - To boost fish farming or fishing activities in freshwater bodies. - Fishing in reservoirs, aquaculture in ponds, and catch from rivers increase fish production and boost inland fisheries. - The main objective is to provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Tribe fishermen in the state and increase fish production.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be Individuals/societies/self-help groups/associations/reservoir monopolies/private units, etc., involved in inland fisheries activities can avail the benefits of inland schemes.
1. The applicant must be from the Scheduled Tribes.
1. The applicant must be involved in the Inland Schemes.
1. The applicant should be above 18 years.
1. The beneficiary fisherman must have his own bank account.
1. The applicant must have an Aadhaar Card/Voter ID/Ration Card/Passport as proof of identity.
benefits: 1. Scheduled Tribe trainees are given a training kit worth ₹2,500/- after completing three months of training.
1. The kit includes cast nets, gill nets with seekers and floats, nylon twine, cotton ropes, plastic ropes, and net-weaving equipment.
> **Training Kit:** The kit is provided after the successful completion of a three-month training program.
> **Frequency of Disbursement:** The benefits for this component can be reclaimed only once in a lifetime.

scheme_name: PMMSY: Refrigerated vehicles - Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance for the purchase of vehicles. Through this scheme, subsidy benefits are provided to general, women, and SC/ST category beneficiaries.
full_description:
The scheme “Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY)” with the component of "Refrigerated vehicles", introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to modernise cold chain infrastructure to preserve fish health, uplift fishermen, and enhance value chain efficiency. Through this scheme, financial support is provided to fishermen and related beneficiaries for constructing ice plants or storage units with a minimum capacity of 30 tonnes, ensuring hygienic fish storage and better returns. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries of the State Governments, with 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% contribution from the State Government.
> **Objective of the scheme** - Marine production in the Gujarat state is one of the leading in the country. The state lags behind in exports due to non-norms. So cold storage/ice plant modernization is necessary to keep the fish in healthy condition. - Insulated vehicle, three wheeler with ice box including e-rickshaw, and live fish vending center to deliver the fish in hygienic condition to the consumer, so that the consumer (customer) can get fresh and clean fish from the local area and get good returns to the sellers. - Around 27,000 small and large boats are operating in the state. To strengthen the safety and security of the fishermen and increase the income of the boat owner, replacement of the existing boats is necessary to increase the sea growth of the existing boats.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a native of Gujarat state.
1. The applicant should have a fishing boat registered under Real Craft software.
1. The applicant should hold a fishing license.

1. The applicant should complete the online registration on the [iKhedut Portal](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/site/).1. The applicant should obtain in-principle approval before purchase of the floor plan.
1. The applicant should have his/her own bank account.
> **Preference/Reservation/Relaxation:**
Women, SC, and ST beneficiaries are eligible for 60% assistance of the unit cost.
General category beneficiaries are eligible for 40% assistance of the unit cost.
benefits: 1. The unit cost of a refrigerated vehicle is ₹25,00,000/-.
1. 40% assistance (up to ₹10,00,000/-) is provided for general category beneficiaries.
1. 60% assistance (up to ₹15,00,000/-) is provided for women and SC/ST category beneficiaries.
> **Conditions:**
The benefit will be available as per the target (category) allocated by the Government of India.
The benefit is available once in a lifetime.
> **Mode of Disbursement:** Contribution is shared: 60% by the Government of India and 40% by State Governments.
> **Frequency of Disbursement:** One-time assistance.
> **Validity:** Once in a lifetime for eligible beneficiaries.

scheme_name: Investment Grant for Farmers with More than 2 Hectares of Agricultural Land
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to farmers owning more than 2 hectares of agricultural land who suffer crop losses due to natural disasters.
full_description: The scheme “Investment Grant for Farmers with More than 2 Hectares of Agricultural Land” is implemented by the Uttarakhand State Disaster Management Authority under the Department of Disaster Management, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to farmers owning more than 2 hectares of agricultural land who suffer crop losses due to natural disasters.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident farmer of Uttarakhand engaged in agricultural activities within the state.
1. The financial assistance will be applicable only for the area actually sown with crops.
benefits: Under this scheme:
1. ₹8,500/- per hectare for unirrigated areas.
1. ₹17,000/- per hectare for areas with assured irrigation.
1. ₹22,500/- per hectare for all types of evergreen crops.
In cases where crop damage exceeds 33%, assistance will be provided only up to a maximum limit of 2 hectares per farmer.

scheme_name: Prime Minister’s Rural Development Fellows Scheme
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide short term catalytic support to the District Administration in backward districts to improve programme delivery and simultaneously develop a cadre of Development Facilitators. Fellows receive professional experience, structured learning, and a monthly stipend.
full_description: The scheme "Prime Minister’s Rural Development Fellows Scheme" by the Department of Rural Development, Ministry of Rural Development, Government of India, aims to provide a short-term work opportunity for young women and men who possess academic or professional expertise that will serve the district administration in improving programme delivery and interface with the marginalized section of the population, thereby aiming to reduce developmental and governance deficits. The scheme provides structured learning and hands-on professional experience in rural development and poverty reduction, offering Fellows opportunities to act as Development Facilitators and assist District Administration, particularly in backward districts, while participating in a post-graduate degree programme through distance learning and contact sessions, leading to a post-graduate degree in Development Practice.
eligibility: The applicant should be a citizen of India.
The applicant's age must be between 22 years and 27 years at the time of application.
The applicant must hold at least a graduate degree from a recognized University with a four-year degree course.
The applicant must hold a post-graduate degree from a recognized University in case the graduate degree course duration was less than four years.

The applicant's one-year post graduate course will also be considered valid for eligibility if it is regular, full time, and if the degree/equivalent diploma is recognized by the All India Council for Technical Education/Medical Council of India/University Grants Commission.
The applicant must have achieved at least 50% marks in the aggregate or equivalent grade at the graduate or Post-graduate level, whichever is qualifying.
The applicant must possess physical fitness, certified by Government Medical Hospital, for the arduous nature of the work.
The maximum age limit will be 32 years for candidates belonging to the Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe category.
> ***Other Conditions***
_*Fifteen percent (15%) of seats are reserved for Scheduled Castes._
_*Fifteen percent (15%) of seats are reserved for Scheduled Tribes._
benefits: ##### ***Stipend Package***
The Fellow shall be entitled to a consolidated stipend package of ₹50,000/- (Rupees Fifty thousand only) per month during the orientation period.
The Fellow shall be entitled to ₹75,000/- (Rupees Seventy Five Thousand only) per month during the first year of the Fellowship (post-orientation).
The Fellow shall receive a 10% increment during the second year, subject to satisfactory performance.

This package is deemed to cover the Fellow’s honorarium, boarding and lodging expenses during orientation, accommodation/house rent during the rest of the Fellowship period, health insurance, life and disability insurance cover, and any other contingency expenses.

Travel reimbursement will be based on actual costs and restricted to AC-II tier train fare by the shortest route or equivalent, plus local transport cost. Women Fellows with children below five years are allowed the travel cost of a care-giver if the care-giver accompanies the Fellow with her child.
##### ***Other Benefits***
Participation in a post graduate degree programme through distance learning and contact sessions leading to a post graduate degree in Development Practice.
Award of a Fellowship Certificate and an appropriate post graduate degree in Development Practice upon satisfactory completion of engagement and course requirements.
Office facilities made available by the District Collector, including suitable space, a computer/laptop, and internet connectivity free of charge.
Provision of suitable modes of transport by District administration while travelling within the district for regular work.
##### ***Disbursement of Stipend***
During the orientation programme, the stipend shall be paid by the National Rural Livelihood Promotion Society through the Programme Mentor.
Post-placement, the National Rural Livelihood Promotion Society shall pay the monthly stipend to the Fellows by providing budgetary support to the State Rural Livelihood Mission society.

The State Rural Livelihood Mission society shall make direct deposits into the bank account of each Fellow immediately upon confirming the attendance of the Fellow from the District Collector at the end of the month.
The second-year increment is subject to the Fellow’s satisfactory performance as determined by the National Rural Livelihood Promotion Society in consultation with the Programme Mentor.
> ***Conditions***
_*It is mandatory for the Fellows to purchase suitable health insurance and life and disability insurance coverage for the entire duration of the Fellowship, including the orientation period._
_*The Fellow shall not take up any type of employment with any other person, firm, or agency during the tenure of the Fellowship._

_*On successful completion of Fellowship, the Fellow is required to spend at least one year in public service as a paid full-time employee of the State Rural Livelihood Mission in the State she/he is assigned to._

_*Failure to join or complete the required one year of public service mandates the Fellow to return to the National Rural Livelihood Promotion Society the entire amount spent on academic programmes during the Fellowship (including orientation), plus an amount equivalent to the stipend of the last three months of the Fellowship period as compensation._
exclusions: The applicant, who has been provisionally selected in the final result sheet for Prime Minister’s Rural Development Fellowship in an earlier stint, will not be allowed to avail the fellowship if he/she did not complete the full term of that prior Fellowship.

scheme_name: Compensation for Loss of Life and Property Caused by Wild Animals in and around Forest Areas: Assistance for Loss of Cattle Due to Wild Animal Attacks
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to owners of domestic animals who suffer losses due to attacks by wild animals in forest areas and their surroundings. Under this scheme, a grant ranging from ₹3,000 to ₹40,000 per animal is provided, depending on the species and extent of loss.
full_description: The scheme “Assistance for Loss of Cattle Due to Wild Animal Attacks” is a sub-component of the umbrella scheme “Compensation for Loss of Life and Property Caused by Wild Animals in and Around Forest Areas”, which is implemented by the Department of Forest, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to owners of domestic animals who suffer losses due to attacks by wild animals in forest areas and their surroundings.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The compensation is applicable only for the loss of domestic animals caused by any of the following wild animals:
Tiger
Leopard
Snow Leopard
All three species of Bear
Hyena
Wild Boar
Crocodile/Gharial
Snake
benefits: **At present, the following compensation amounts are provided in case of animal loss due to attacks by wild animals:**

**Type of Animal Loss****Total Payable Amount****Share of State Disaster Response Fund****Share of Human Wildlife Conflict Relief Distribution Fund**Milch Animals- Buffalo / Cow / Camel / Yak / Mithun etc. (Per Animal)₹30,000/-₹30,000/----Agricultural and Transport Animals – Camel, Horse (per Animal)₹40,000/-₹25,000/-₹15,000/-Mule (per Animal)₹40,000/-₹16,000/-₹24,000/-Bull (per Animal)₹25,000/-₹25,000/----Heifer/Donkey/Pony (per Animal)₹16,000/-₹16,000/----Sheep/Goat/Pig (per Animal)₹3,000/-₹3,000/----

scheme_name: Mahila Dairy Vikas Pariyojana - Uttarakhand
brief_description: The scheme aims to empower rural women in Uttarakhand by promoting their active participation in the dairy sector through Women Milk Producers Cooperative Societies, enhancing milk production, and providing training, incentives, and awareness programs for sustainable livelihood development.
full_description: The scheme “Mahila Dairy Vikas Pariyojana” was launched by the Department of Dairy Development, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to empower rural women in Uttarakhand by promoting their active participation in the dairy sector through Women Milk Producers Cooperative Societies, enhancing milk production, and providing training, incentives, and awareness programs for sustainable livelihood development.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant must be a woman interested in the milk procurement business sector.
benefits: Under this scheme, by providing adequate resources to rural women through Women Milk Producers Cooperative Societies at the village level, their direct participation in the state’s economy is encouraged, making them socially and economically self-reliant.

The scheme also organizes various training, incentive, and awareness programs for women members to increase milk production. These include training programs for secretaries and management committee members, women encouragement and motivational programs, seminars on clean milk procurement, and special women-focused seminars on the occasion of International Women’s Day.
Under the women incentive program to increase milk procurement, first, second, and third prizes are awarded to the women milk producers who supply the maximum milk in the district.

scheme_name: Kisan Credit Card (Pashupalan)
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide short-term working capital loans for livestock activities by offering eligible livestock farmers interest-subsidized loans for operational purposes through banks.
full_description: The "Kisan Credit Card (Pashupalan)" scheme is launched by the Animal Husbandry and Dairy Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The schheme provides short-term working capital loans to livestock farmers at subsidized interest rates. Eligible livestock farmers, dairy producers, and members of primary agricultural credit cooperative societies can avail financial support for operational purposes through banks.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Madhya Pradesh.
1. The applicant must be a livestock farmer or a member of a primary agricultural credit cooperative society.
1. The applicant should require short-term working capital for livestock activities, including dairy production.
benefits: Short-term working capital loan for livestock activities through the Kisan Credit Card system.
Interest subsidy is provided on loans sanctioned under the scheme.
Expected Time of Disbursement: Typically within 15 days of application approval.

scheme_name: Compensation for Human Death or Injury Caused by Wild Animals
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide financial relief to victims or families affected by wild animal attacks in both urban and rural areas through timely monetary compensation.
full_description: The “Compensation for Human Death or Injury Caused by Wild Animals” scheme is launched by the Forest Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to provide financial relief to the families of deceased persons or individuals injured due to attacks by wild animals. The scheme covers both urban and rural areas and ensures quick assistance through a time-bound process.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Madhya Pradesh.
1. The applicant should be a victim of a wild animal attack, resulting in injury or death.
1. The applicant should submit proof that the injury or death was caused by a wild animal (excluding snakes, monitor lizards, and other poisonous creatures).
1. In the case of death, the applicant must be a legal heir, family member, or relative of the deceased person.
benefits: **Compensation Amount:**

**In case of death:** ₹4,00,000 is paid to the deceased’s legal heir or family member after deducting any temporary assistance already given and the actual cost of medical treatment before death.- **In case of injury:** Actual medical expenses are reimbursed, along with ₹500 per day (maximum ₹50,000) if hospitalized, after deducting any temporary assistance already provided.
**Expected Time of Disbursement:**
Within 3 working days in case of death.
Within 7 working days in case of injury.
**Mode of Disbursement:**
The payment is made directly to the beneficiary’s bank account via e-payment.

scheme_name: Special Scheme for Increasing the Storage Capacity of Perishable Products
brief_description: The scheme aims to increase the storage capacity of perishable products by providing grant assistance for cold storage facilities.
full_description: The scheme “Special Scheme for Increasing the Storage Capacity of Perishable Products” launched by the Horticulture and Food Processing Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, aims to increase cold storage capacity through providing 50% grant assistance to all eligible farmers.
eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer.
The applicant must be a resident of Madhya Pradesh.
benefits: Grant Assistance: A grant of 50% of the project cost up to a maximum of ₹2,00,00,000/- for cold storage facilities up to 5,000 metric tons capacity.

scheme_name: Sub-Mission on Agricultural Mechanization (SMAM) for Custom Hiring Centres / Big Farmers - Uttarakhand
brief_description: Under this scheme, individual large farmers, farmer groups, cooperatives, self-help groups, and custom hiring centres in the state can purchase agricultural equipment at a subsidized rate, with the Government of India providing a maximum subsidy of 40%.
full_description: The scheme “Sub-Mission on Agricultural Mechanization for Custom Hiring Centres / Big Farmers” is implemented by the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to promote agricultural mechanization and enhance farm productivity by facilitating access to modern farm machinery. Under this scheme, individual large farmers, farmer groups, cooperatives, self-help groups, and custom hiring centres in the state can purchase agricultural equipment at a subsidized rate, with the Government of India providing a maximum subsidy of 40%.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a large farmer (owning 5 hectares or more of land), a cooperative group, self-help group, or a custom hiring centre in Uttarakhand.
1. The farmer or group must have cultivable land located in Uttarakhand.
1. For an individual large farmer, their name must be recorded in the revenue records. For a group, the names of all group members must be listed in the agricultural land documents.
benefits: Under the Custom Hiring Centre component (for groups of farmers involved in buying, renting, or selling agricultural equipment), farmer groups, cooperatives, FPOs, self-help groups, and individual farmers can purchase equipment valued between ₹10.00 lakh and ₹100.00 lakh. The Government of India provides a maximum subsidy of 40% on such purchases.

scheme_name: Sub-Mission on Agricultural Mechanization - Uttarakhand
brief_description: The scheme aims to encourage farm mechanization purchasing and providing 50% subsidy/financial assistance to SC/ST, small and marginal, and women farmers (of all categories), while 40% subsidy/financial assistance is provided to other (large) farmers.
full_description: The scheme “Sub-Mission on Agricultural Mechanization” is implemented by the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to encourage farm mechanization by providing financial assistance/subsidy to farmers for purchasing modern farm equipment. This initiative particularly focuses on supporting small, marginal, SC/ST, and women farmers by making advanced agricultural machinery accessible and affordable to them.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant must be a farmer engaged in agricultural activities.

1. SC/ST farmers, small and marginal farmers, and women farmers (of all castes) are eligible for 50% financial assistance under the scheme, while 40% subsidy/financial assistance is provided to other (large) farmers.
1. The name of the applicant farmer must be recorded in the revenue records of the cultivable land owned or cultivated by them.
benefits: Under the scheme, all farmers of the state are eligible to receive financial assistance for the purchase of modern agricultural equipment for farming. A 50% subsidy/financial assistance is provided to SC/ST, small and marginal, and women farmers (of all categories), while 40% subsidy/financial assistance is provided to other (large) farmers. The details are as follows:

scheme_name: Bari (Kitchen Garden) Scheme
brief_description: The scheme aims to promote kitchen gardening among poor and small/marginal farmers and agricultural laborers living below the poverty line by providing free vegetable seed packets.
full_description: The scheme “Bari (Kitchen Garden) Scheme” launched by the Horticulture and Food Processing Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, aims to promote kitchen gardening through the free distribution of vegetable seed packets worth ₹75 to poor, small/marginal farmers and agricultural laborers living below the poverty line.
eligibility: The applicant must be a small or marginal farmer/agricultural laborer.
The applicant must be a resident of Madhya Pradesh.
The applicant must belong to the Below the Poverty Line (BPL) category.
benefits: Free Vegetable Seed Packets: Each eligible beneficiary receives a packet of vegetable seeds worth ₹75 free of cost.

scheme_name: Exhibition Fair and Publicity
brief_description: The scheme aims to promote departmental schemes and disseminate information about the technology of fruit, flower, vegetable, and spice crops to farmers through exhibitions and seminars organized at the district and block levels.
eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer.
The applicant must be a resident of Madhya Pradesh.
benefits: **Awareness Creation:** Farmers receive knowledge about horticulture schemes and technologies related to fruit, flower, vegetable, and spice crops.  - **Scheme Promotion:** Departmental schemes are publicized to ensure more participation and benefit utilization among farmers.

scheme_name: Annapurna Scheme: Seed Exchange Programme
brief_description: The scheme aims to increase agricultural productivity and production for SC/ST farmers who cannot afford improved seeds. It provides high-yielding improved seed varieties, up to one hectare, in exchange for existing crop or seed, backed by a 75% subsidy with a maximum limit of ₹1,500/-.
full_description: The “Annapurna Scheme” was launched by the Department of Farmers Welfare and Agricultural Development, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The “Seed Exchange Programme” component of the scheme aims to improve the economic status of Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe small and marginal farmers by providing them with economic assistance to access improved seeds of high-yielding foodgrain crops, thereby increasing productivity and production. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Agriculture through the District Panchayats, Sub-Directorate of Agriculture, and the Senior Agriculture Development Officer. The applications for this scheme are accepted by the Rural Agriculture Extension Officer based on targets set according to the population of the target groups and the district's demand.
eligibility: The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe category.
The applicant must be a small or marginal farmer.
The applicant must be unable to afford the purchase of improved varieties of high-yielding foodgrain crops.
***Post-Selection Conditions***
The farmer must exchange their existing crop or seed for the improved seeds.
benefits: Provision of improved seeds of high-yielding varieties of foodgrain crops.
75% subsidy on the actual price of the seed provided in exchange.
The maximum limit of the subsidy is ₹1,500/-.
Seeds of suitable varieties for the land and area will be provided in equal quantity compared to the seed provided by the farmer.
The provision is limited to a maximum area of one hectare.
Certified seed will be provided.
##### ***Conditions***
_The seeds supplied must be of the improved variety, prioritizing those that are suitable for or prevalent in the area._
_If certified seed is scarce, or depending on the specific crop condition, true form seed may be distributed only with the permission of the Director of Agriculture._
_If the farmer provides seed of a different crop for exchange, the seed given by the farmer must be worth 25% of the actual price of the certified seed of the requested crop._
_The improved seed provided to the farmer will not exceed the requirement for one hectare._
_The seed received from the beneficiary farmer must be sold through auction (Ghosh Vikray) at the local Agricultural Produce Market Committee by a designated committee._

_Cash received as the farmer's share or resulting from the auction of the grain provided by the farmer must be deposited into the Government Treasury by challan under Head 0401 Agriculture Work, Other Deposit - 800 Other Deposit._
_If a farmer who previously received seed is given seed again, it must not be for the same crop or variety provided in prior years._
exclusions: The applicant will not be supplied improved seed exceeding the requirement for one hectare.
If the farmer is an existing beneficiary, the subsequent provision of seed must be for a different crop or variety than those previously supplied.

scheme_name: Assistance Towards Sugarcane Supplied By The Sugarcane Growers
brief_description: The scheme aims to assist Sugarcane Growers to take up sugarcane cultivation in the State of Goa. It provides financial support to farmers cultivating sugarcane, paid based on actual tonnage supplied at the factory weighbridge as per the Fair & Remunerative Price.
full_description: The scheme "Assistance Towards Sugarcane Supplied By The Sugarcane Growers" was launched by the Department of Agriculture, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to assist the Sugarcane Growers to take up sugarcane cultivation in Goa. The scheme provides financial assistance based on the actual tonnage of canes weighed at the Sugar factory weighbridge, determined by the Fair & Remunerative Price (FRP) fixed by the National Federation of Co-operative Sugar Factories Limited, New Delhi. The applicant must be a farmer cultivating sugarcane in the State of Goa, possess a valid Krishi Card, and bear the cost of harvesting and transporting the harvested cane to Sanjivani Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana, Dayanandnagar Dharbandora. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Agriculture. The applications for this scheme are accepted via registration through Sanjivani Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana (SSSKL).
eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer.
The applicant must be cultivating sugarcane in Goa.
The applicant must possess a valid Krishi Card issued by the Directorate of Agriculture.

The applicant must ensure the sugarcane area is verified by the representatives of the Zonal Agriculture Office of the respective Taluka, along with the Fieldman of Sanjivani Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana (SSSKL).
The applicant must be issued an area certificate following verification of the sugarcane area.
The applicant must be present for the inspection of the harvested cane by the Fieldman of Sanjivani Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana (SSSKL) or any representative of the Agriculture Department.
benefits: Financial assistance is provided based on the Fair & Remunerative Price (FRP) fixed by the National Federation of Co-operative Sugar Factories Limited, New Delhi, from time to time.
Farmers will be paid based on the actual tonnage of canes weighed at the Sugar factory weighbridge.
> ***Conditions***
The farmers must harvest and supply the sugarcane on their own to Sanjivani Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana (SSSKL).
The harvested cane must be loaded and brought to Sanjivani Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana, Dayanandnagar Dharbandora by the farmer on his own cost.
The farmer must duly sign the GAR 32 form, which is used in the submission process by Sanjivani Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana to the Zonal Agricultural Office.
The Government or Sanjivani Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana will not take any responsibility to harvest and transport the sugarcane.

scheme_name: Mukhyamantri Krishak Mitra Yojana
brief_description: The scheme aims to create necessary infrastructure by the distribution company for providing permanent pump connections to farmers or groups of farmers.
full_description: The scheme “Mukhyamantri Krushak Mitra Yojana” launched by the Energy Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, aims to create infrastructure for permanent agricultural pump connections through the distribution company. The scheme provides grants and cost-sharing support to farmers and distribution companies for infrastructure development.
eligibility: The applicant should be a landholding farmer/group-farmer.
benefits: **Cost Sharing Support:** Only 50% of the infrastructure development cost will be borne by the concerned farmer or group of farmers.
**Government Grant:** 40% of the cost will be provided directly by the State Government to the power distribution company as a grant.

scheme_name: Annapurna Scheme: Seed Production Programme
brief_description: The scheme aims to enhance the production and economic status of Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe small and marginal farmers. It provides Foundation or Certified Grade I seeds for high-yielding food grain crops with a 75% subsidy to registered farmers operating near Government agricultural farms.
full_description: The “Annapurna Scheme” was launched by the Department of Farmers Welfare and Agricultural Development, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The “Seed Production Programme” component of the scheme aims to improve the economic condition of small and marginal farmers belonging to the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes by providing economic assistance for improved seeds, thereby increasing productivity and production. The scheme provides Foundation or Certified Grade I seeds of improved, high-yielding food grain crops to selected farmers for seed production up to a limit of 1 hectare, along with a 75% subsidy on the actual cost of the seed.
eligibility: The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe.
The applicant must be a small or marginal farmer.
The applicant must be willing to participate in the “Seed Production Programme”.
The applicant must operate within the 10-kilometer periphery of the selected Government agricultural farms.
The applicant must conduct the program on a minimum area of 0.2 hectares (1/2 acre).
The applicant must be eligible for a maximum grant up to 1 hectare.
The applicant must mandatorily register with the Seed Certification Agency.
The plan includes the food grain crops Paddy (Dhan), Jowar, Bajra, Maize, Kodo, Kutki, Ragi (for Kharif), and Wheat (Gehu), Barley (Jau) (for Rabi).
****Preference should be given to the names listed first in the approved list.***
****The waiting list will remain valid only until the crop season.***
***Implementation Area***
The Seed Production Programme will be implemented within the 10-kilometer periphery of the following Government agricultural farms:

_Gohad (Bhind), Mahuakheda (Gwalior), Indergarh (Datia), Gazaura (Shivpuri), Rannod (Shivpuri), Gariyaband (Raipur), Khairibilari (Raipur), Mohgaon (Durg), Surgi (Rajnandgaon), Bhavarmara (Rajnandgaon), Amethi (Raigarh), Ragja (Janjgir), Lakhanpur (Korba), Gehwara (Satna), Samda (Sidhi), Jabera (Damoh), Naogaon (Chhatarpur), Ajaygarh (Panna), Bhomakhatiya (Seoni), Kinhi (Balaghat), Delakhedi (Chhindwara), Narsinghpur (Narsinghpur), Pirprod (Katni), Manpur (Umariya), Bhikangaon (Khargone), Chandrakeshar (Dewas), Girwar (Shajapur), Panched (Ratlam), Patan (Mandsaur), Phanda (Bhopal), Rehthi (Sehore), Silwani (Raisen), Gundgaon (Betul), Sarangpur (Rajgarh), Keralapal (Jagdalpur), Kanker (Kanker), Pankhajor (Kanker), Chalta (Sitapur Surguja), Lohari (Koriya), Ori (Mandla), Biridodogari (Mandla), Birhuliya (Shahdol), Nogaon (Dhar), Jobat (Jhabua), Alirajpur (Jhabua), Garhi (Balaghat)._
benefits: Provision of Foundation or Certified Grade I seeds of improved varieties of high-yielding food grain crops for seed production.
Eligibility for a 75% subsidy on the actual cost of the Foundation or Certified seed up to a maximum area of 1 hectare.
Payment for registration (application fee, registration fee, inspection fee, and sample fee) with the Seed Certification Agency will be covered from the scheme budget.

Technical training and necessary information will be provided by the Rural Agricultural Extension Officer, Senior Agricultural Development Officer, and Subject Matter Specialist (Sub-Divisional level).
Guaranteed procurement of the produced seed by the Seed Production Committee or Farm Superintendent at government-fixed rates.

Expenditure related to the grading, processing, stocking, and packing of raw seeds produced on Government agricultural farms can be carried out by the Deputy Director of Agriculture from the scheme budget.
***Conditions***
_The farmer must utilize the seed provided for a maximum area of 1 hectare and a minimum area of 0.2 hectares (1/2 acre)._
_The farmer must adopt the complete package of agricultural practices for higher production._
_The farmer must ensure the removal of undesirable plants to maintain seed purity._
_The farmer must sign an agreement with the department through the Seed Production Committee or Farm Superintendent regarding seed production, procurement, and payment according to the policy._
_The farmer must pay the remaining 25% of the seed cost in cash or by providing their own seed._
_If the farmer provides their own seed, the price of that seed will be determined based on the support price._
_The produced Certified Seed must be made available to other Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe farmers under the scheme in the subsequent year._

_The expenditure incurred on processing, grading, stocking, and packing will be deducted from the fixed price of the supplied seed, and the remaining amount must be deposited into the government treasury._

scheme_name: Special Scheme for Increasing the Storage Capacity of Perishable Products
brief_description: The scheme aims to increase the storage capacity of perishable products by providing grant assistance for cold storage facilities.
full_description: The scheme “Special Scheme for Increasing the Storage Capacity of Perishable Products” launched by the Horticulture and Food Processing Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, aims to increase cold storage capacity through providing 50% grant assistance to all eligible farmers.
eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer.
The applicant must be a resident of Madhya Pradesh.
benefits: Grant Assistance: A grant of 50% of the project cost up to a maximum of ₹2,00,00,000/- for cold storage facilities up to 5,000 metric tons capacity.

scheme_name: Madhya Pradesh Lok Vaniki Yojana
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide for the management of tree covered areas located on private land and revenue land under the MP Public Forestry Act, 2001. The scheme benefits landowners, Gram Panchayats, or Gram Sabhas by allowing them to undertake the scientific management of their tree covered areas.
full_description: The scheme “Madhya Pradesh Lok Vaniki Yojana” was launched by the Forest Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to manage private and revenue tree covered areas. The scheme provides for the scientific management of tree covered areas located in private and revenue lands, where the management is proposed voluntarily by the landowner, Gram Panchayat, or Gram Sabha. Key features include the creation of technical management plans (Prabandh Yojana) which are subject to approval by the competent authority. The applications for this scheme are accepted by submitting the proposal to the Divisional Officer (Van Mandal Adhikari) or the Range Officer (Van Kshetra Adhikari).
eligibility: The applicant must be a landowner who desires to take responsibility for the management of any tree covered area.
The applicant must be a Gram Panchayat or a Gram Sabha who desires to take responsibility for the management of any tree covered revenue land located within its jurisdiction.
The applicant must apply to the Tehsildar (Revenue) for the demarcation and management of the land as "Lok Van" (Public Forest), if the land is tree covered revenue land.
The applicant must submit the management proposal to the Divisional Officer (Van Mandal Adhikari) or the Range Officer (Van Kshetra Adhikari).
The applicant (Landowner) must attach a declaration regarding land title/possession, including an attested photocopy of the latest land records (Khasra).
The applicant (Gram Panchayat/Gram Sabha) must submit a resolution to the Tehsildar (Revenue) after getting the land demarcated and handed over for management as "Lok Van".
benefits: Authorization for scientific management of tree-covered areas.
##### ***Conditions***
_The designated Landowner, Gram Panchayat, or Gram Sabha must implement the Technical Management Plan according to the activities and conditions specified within the plan._
_For "Lok Van" (Public Forest) management plans, the Gram Sabha must authorize the implementation of the specified activities through a resolution of the Social Audit Committee._

_If the management plan involves harvesting timber, the concerned Landowner, Gram Panchayat, or Gram Sabha must provide advance notification regarding the proposed date of harvesting to the Range Officer (Van Kshetra Adhikari) or Tehsildar, at least seven days prior to the proposed date._
