scheme_name: Nariwal Paudha Vitaran Yojana
brief_description: The scheme aimed at promoting coconut cultivation in non-traditional areas like Bihar. Under this scheme, farmers and urban residents can obtain coconut saplings at a subsidized rate to encourage widespread plantation and utilization.
full_description: The “Nariwal Paudha Vitaran Yojana”, launched by the Department of Agriculture, Bihar, is designed to distribute coconut saplings to farmers and individuals willing to plant on their land. The main objective of this scheme is to plant coconut saplings in non-traditional coconut areas in the state.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Bihar.
1. The applicant should be a farmer.
1. The applicant should be interested in planting coconut saplings.
1. The applicant must be registered on the DBT portal.
<br>
> **Note 1: Beneficiary allocation:**
General Category: 78.56%.
Scheduled Castes: 20%.
Scheduled Tribes: 1.44%.
Women Participation: 30%.
> **Note 2:** The benefit of the scheme will generally be given to the farmer family. Farmer family means husband-wife and minor child.
> **Note 3:** Beneficiaries will be selected on first come first serve basis.
benefits: **Subsidy Support:** 75% subsidy i.e. ₹63.75/- will be payable on the unit cost of ₹85/- per sapling.  - **Distribution of Saplings:** A minimum of 5 and a maximum of 712 saplings (178 saplings per hectare) will be provided to beneficiaries.

scheme_name: Mukhyamantri Bagwani Mission: Anjeer Vikas Yojana
brief_description: The Scheme aims to expand plantain cultivation across all districts in Bihar. Farmers can receive subsidies for up to 10 acres and access high-quality tissue-cultured plants for cultivation.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Bihar.
1. The applicant should be a ryot farmer.
1. The applicant must have agricultural land a minimum of 0.25 acres (0.1 ha) and a maximum of 10 acres (4 ha).
1. The applicant must be registered on the DBT portal.
> **Note 1: Beneficiary allocation:**
General Category: 78.56%.
Scheduled Castes: 20%.
Scheduled Tribes: 1.44%.
Women Participation: 30%.
> **Note 2:** Beneficiaries will be selected on first come first serve basis.
benefits: > **Financial Support:**
**First year:** ₹30,000/- per hectare.  - **Second and third year:** ₹10,000/- per hectare (per year).
> **Plant Distribution:**
Supply of high-quality plants.

scheme_name: Pandit Deen Dayal Upadhyay Samoohik Pashudhan Beema Yojana
brief_description: The scheme "Pandit Deen Dayal Upadhyay Samoohik Pashudhan Beema Yojana" aims to provide socio-economic security to livestock farmers in the state by covering livestock under an insurance scheme. Financial protection against the risk of loss due to animal death is extended to livestock owners.
full_description: The scheme "Pandit Deen Dayal Upadhyay Samoohik Pashudhan Beema Yojana" by the Haryana Livestock Development Board, Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying, Government of Haryana, aims to provide socio-economic security to livestock farmers in the state by covering livestock under an insurance scheme. Financial protection against the risk of loss due to animal death is extended to livestock owners, including Scheduled Caste (SC) and Below Poverty Line (BPL) beneficiaries, with subsidised premium rates.
eligibility: The applicant should be a livestock owner.
The applicant should be above 18 years of age.
The applicant should possess a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP), issued by the state of Haryana.
**Preference and Relaxations**
Applicants from Scheduled Caste and Below Poverty Line categories will be given priority.
Scheduled Caste beneficiaries are exempt from paying premiums; the state and central governments fully subsidize their insurance.
benefits: **Financial Protection**
Coverage for livestock loss due to death, providing financial security to farmers.
Sum insured is determined based on the market value of livestock and milk yield.
Maximum coverage is up to five large animals or equivalent small animals per household.
**Subsidized Premiums**
APL beneficiaries pay ₹100/200/300 per large animal per year based on milk yield or ₹25/- per small animal.
BPL beneficiaries receive additional subsidies, and SC beneficiaries have their entire premium covered by the state and central government.
**Mode and Frequency of Disbursement**
Claims are settled through direct bank transfers to beneficiaries.
Accidental death claims are covered immediately; non-accidental death claims are covered after a 21-day waiting period.
**Expected Time of Disbursement**
Insurance companies are required to settle claims within 15 days of document submission. Delays incur a penalty of 12% compound interest per annum.
exclusions: Livestock owners without a valid PPP are ineligible.
Claims for animals without proper ear-tagging and documentation will not be entertained.

scheme_name: Special Livestock Insurance Scheme
brief_description: "Special Livestock Insurance Scheme" is a welfare initiative targeting SC families engaged in livestock rearing. The scheme provides free insurance for livestock, enhancing the economic security of resource-poor SC families. The scheme covers milch animals, sheep, goats, pigs, camels, etc;
full_description: "Special Livestock Insurance Scheme" by the Animal Husbandry & Dairying Department, Government of Haryana is a continuation of a welfare initiative targeting scheduled caste families engaged in livestock rearing. The scheme is designed to provide free insurance for livestock, enhancing the economic security of resource-poor Scheduled Caste families. It has been allocated a budget of ₹3,00,00,000/- by the State Government and aims to cover various livestock species, including milch animals, sheep, goats, pigs, pack animals, and camels.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be from a Scheduled Caste family.
1. The livestock of the applicant should include milch buffaloes, milch cattle, sheep, goats, pigs, pack animals, or camels.
1. The animals must be owned by the applicant.
1. The animals should be reared within the State.
_*Livestock units established under the “Scheme for Providing Employment Opportunities to Scheduled Castes” are automatically eligible._
benefits: 1. **Free Insurance Coverage:** For livestock owned by Scheduled Caste families, ensuring financial protection in case of animal loss.1. **Employment Support:** Covers livestock units established under the “Scheme for Providing Employment Opportunities to Scheduled Castes (SCSP).”1. **Wide Coverage:** Includes dairy, piggery, sheep, goat units, milch buffalo, cattle, pack animals, and camels.1. **Publicity and Awareness:** ₹5,50,000/- allocated for widespread publicity to ensure maximum participation.1. **Veterinary Support:** Honorarium to Veterinary Surgeons for health and post-mortem certificates.1. **Cost-Free to Beneficiaries:** Entire costs related to insurance premiums, publicity, and veterinary support are borne by the State Government.
exclusions: Livestock not owned by Scheduled Caste families.
Animals without a valid health certificate issued by Veterinary Surgeons.
Losses not covered under the insurance policy terms (e.g., negligence, willful harm).
Livestock not registered under the scheme or insured during the eligibility period.
Claims without proper documentation or post-mortem reports.

scheme_name: Panchayat Secretariat Strengthening Scheme
brief_description: The "Panchayat Secretariat Strengthening Scheme" by the Panchayati Raj Department, Government of Jharkhand, aims to provide financial assistance of ₹15,000 per month to each Gram Panchayat for operational and maintenance purposes, ensuring efficient governance at the grassroots level.
full_description:
The "Panchayat Secretariat Strengthening Scheme" by the Panchayati Raj Department, Government of Jharkhand, aims to enhance the functioning of Gram Panchayats by providing financial support for their operations and maintenance. Under this scheme, a monthly grant of is provided to each Gram Panchayat to cover administrative expenses, infrastructure development, and service enhancements.
**Objective:** 1. Fund Allocation: - Funds are allocated by the District Panchayat Raj Officers to each Panchayat Secretariat. - Funds must be used with the approval of the Panchayat Samiti and should be linked to an e-voucher-based monitoring system. 1. Utilization Guidelines: - Expenditure should be approved for activities like reconciliation of bank accounts, purchase of consumables, repair of computers/equipment, electricity, and water bills. - Panchayat Secretariats must maintain proper records of expenses. 1. Service and Support Centers: - Panchayat Bhavans will host service centers such as Common Service Centres, Post Offices, Bank Branches, ATM services, and Sub-Registrar offices. - These centers will improve public service delivery in rural areas. 1. Sanitation and Infrastructure: - Cleanliness, drinking water, seating arrangements, and cleanliness-related provisions to be maintained using allocated funds. 1. Safety Measures: - Installation of CCTV cameras, lighting, and other safety equipment is encouraged. 1. Digital and Internet Facilities: - Internet recharge and maintenance for seamless online services are covered under this scheme. 1. Electricity and Fuel: - Provision for electricity/fuel for operating Panchayat facilities is also included. 1. Miscellaneous: - Expenditure on new items or costs beyond the allocated amount requires prior approval from competent authorities. - Annual usage will be monitored, and excess expenditure (if any) must be split 50-50 between the Panchayat Secretary and Mukhia.
eligibility: 1. The Gram Panchayats must within the state of Jharkhand.
1. The Gram Panchayat must have an operational Panchayat Secretariat in place to receive and utilize the grant.
1. The Gram Panchayat must maintain proper records, documentation, and reconciliation of expenditures to continue receiving support under the scheme.
benefits: A monthly grant of ₹15,000 per Gram Panchayat for operational expenses.
**NOTE:** Electronic fund transfer mechanism for timely disbursement every quarter.

scheme_name: Chief Minister Small and Marginal Farmers Older Pension Scheme
brief_description: The "Chief Minister Small and Marginal Farmers Older Pension Scheme" by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of Rajasthan, aims to provide financial assistance to elderly small and marginal farmers.
full_description: The "Chief Minister Small and Marginal Farmers Older Pension Scheme" implemented by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of Rajasthan, aims to provide financial assistance to elderly small and marginal farmers for their social and economic well-being.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant must belong to a small and marginal farmer family.
1. The minimum age requirement is:
55 years or above for women.
58 years or above for men.

**NOTE:** Small and marginal farmer as per the definition under the National Food Security Ordinance, 2013, and as per the Rajasthan Government's Food and Civil Supplies Department circular dated 31.8.2013.
benefits: **Pension of ₹1250/- per month.**

scheme_name: To Assist the Farmers for Construction of Community Base Water Tank/Storage Structure for Efficient Use of Water Through Drip Irrigation
brief_description: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to farmers for constructing community-based water tanks/storage structures to ensure efficient water use through drip irrigation.
full_description: The scheme &quot;To Assist the Farmers for Construction of Community Base Water Tank/Storage Structure for Efficient Use of Water Through Drip Irrigation&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support farmers in protecting their crops from losses due to irregular rainfall and increasing the state&#39;s irrigated area. By constructing water tanks, farmers can optimize water usage, enhance irrigation efficiency, and boost agricultural production.
eligibility: > **For Individual Farmers:**
The applicant must be a farmer.
The applicant must belong to the Gujarat state.
The water tank must be constructed on the applicant’s own farmland.

The farmer must have adopted the [Micro Irrigation System (MIS)](https://pib.gov.in/PressReleaseIframePage.aspx?PRID=2003188).- The farmer must cover at least one hectare of land per 75 cubic meters of water tank under MIS.
> **For Group of Farmers:**
The group must consist of two or more farmers.
The group must belong to the Gujarat state.
The group must select one farmer as the leader, who will submit the application on behalf of the group.
The water tank must be constructed on the land of one of the farmers in the group.

Each member of the group must have adopted the [Micro Irrigation System (MIS)](https://pib.gov.in/PressReleaseIframePage.aspx?PRID=2003188).- The group must cover at least one hectare of land per 75 cubic meters of water tank under MIS.
> **Note:**
No separate registration is required for the group; they only need to submit a mutual consent certificate.
The benefit is available only once in a lifetime (For both Individual and Group of Farmers).
benefits: **Name of the Component****Standard of Assistance****Minimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming Benefits**Water Tank50% of the cost or ₹9,80,000/- whichever is lessOnce in a lifetime

scheme_name: Scheme of Providing Assistance to Encourage Farmers for Adoption of Organic Farming
brief_description: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Dept., Gujarat. It aims to promote organic farming by providing financial assistance to farmers for certification, input subsidies, and residue testing.
full_description: The &quot;Scheme of Providing Assistance to Encourage Farmers for Adoption of Organic Farming&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to encourage farmers to adopt organic farming by offering financial incentives for certification, registration, and input costs. It helps maintain soil fertility, supports biological input management, and promotes traditional knowledge.
eligibility: The applicant must be an Individual farmer or farmers group.
The applicant should have an interest in practicing certified organic farming system.
benefits: **Name of the Component****Standard of Assistance****Minimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming Benefits**Registration/ CertificationAssistance for Certification/Registration fees 75% from GOPCA and 50% assistance in Certification fees with other certifying Body; Upto Maximum ₹2,000/- per HectareEvery yearInputInput subsidy of ₹5,000/- per Hectare for Certified farmEvery yearResidue testingPer sample Assistance upto ₹1,0000/-Every year

scheme_name: Farm Storage Structure Scheme
brief_description: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Dept., Gujarat. It aims to help farmers to protect their harvested crops from damage due to natural calamities and store them safely for better financial returns by selling at optimal prices.
full_description: The &quot;Farm Storage Structure Scheme&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provides financial assistance to farmers for constructing crop storage structures on their farms. It ensures protection from unforeseen weather conditions like rain and storms and enables farmers to store their produce until market prices are favorable.
eligibility: The applicant must be a land-holding farmer.
The applicant must belong to the Gujarat state.
**Note:**
In case of joint account, beneficiary farmers shall be entitled to benefit only one of the holders of their land mentioned in 8-A subject to the consent of other account holders.
benefits: **Name of the Component****Standard of Assistance****Minimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming  Benefits**Crop Storage Structure50% of the total cost or ₹75,000/- whichever is lessOnly once

scheme_name: Planting Assistance Program for Hybrid Seeds of Vegetable Crops
brief_description: This scheme offers financial assistance to farmers for the plantation of hybrid seeds and promotion of natural farming in vegetable crops across Gujarat.
full_description: The scheme &quot;Planting Assistance Program for Hybrid Seeds of Vegetable Crops&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial support to farmers for the cultivation of hybrid vegetable seeds and encourage natural farming practices.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a farmer.
1. For natural farming component, the farmer must be listed by the district ATMA office or be part of a FIG practicing natural farming.
benefits: 1. Financial support of 40% of the cost incurred for the hybrid seed plantation, ₹50,000/- per hectare unit cost.
1. Maximum assistance of ₹20,000/- per hectare under both components:
Hybrid Seed Plantation.
Promotion of Natural Farming in Vegetable Crops.

scheme_name: Assistance Program for Expansion of Fruit Crop Cultivation
brief_description: The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers in Gujarat for expanding fruit crop cultivation like mango, banana, papaya, etc., through intensive and ultra-intensive farming methods.
full_description: The scheme &quot;Assistance Program for Expansion of Fruit Crop Cultivation&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat,  aims to encourage and support farmers in the state to adopt intensive farming practices and increase the cultivation of fruits such as mango, guava, pomegranate, lemon, banana (tissue culture), and papaya.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a farmer.
1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
1. The applicant must be engaged in horticultural or fruit crop cultivation.
benefits: > **For Intensive and Ultra-Intensive Farming of Mango, Guava, Pomegranate, Lemon, etc.:**
Assistance of ₹30,000/- to ₹40,000/- per hectare.
Maximum up to 4 hectares per beneficiary.
> **For New Plantation of Banana Tissue Culture Crop:**
40% of the incurred cost or maximum ₹50,000/- per hectare.
Maximum up to 4 hectares per beneficiary.
> **For New Plantation of Papaya Crop:**
50% of the incurred cost or maximum ₹30,000/- per hectare.
Paid in two installments.
Maximum up to 4 hectares per beneficiary.

scheme_name: Assistance for Area Expansion of Spice Crops
brief_description: The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers for the area expansion of spice crops, including seed and rhizomatic spices, to enhance spice production in Gujarat.
full_description: The scheme "Assistance for Area Expansion of Spice Crops" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to farmers for the area expansion of spice crops, including seed and rhizomatic spices, to enhance spice production in Gujarat.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a farmer.
1. The applicant must be engaged in the cultivation of spice crops, such as seed spices or rhizomatic spices.
benefits: Maximum assistance up to ₹12,000/- per hectare at 40% of the unit cost of ₹30,000/- per hectare.

scheme_name: Crop Input Subsidy to the Farmers for Crop Loss Due to Natural Calamities
brief_description: The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers in Gujarat who suffer crop losses due to natural calamities, based on crop damage surveys conducted by the district administration.
full_description: The scheme &quot;Crop Input Subsidy to the Farmers for Crop Loss Due to Natural Calamities&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support farmers whose crops have been damaged by natural disasters such as floods, droughts, unseasonal rains, or other calamities. After a damage assessment is conducted by the district administration, eligible farmers receive compensation based on assistance norms defined by the State Government.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a farmer.
1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
1. The applicant must have suffered crop loss due to natural calamity.
benefits: As per the assistance norms fixed by the State Government, keeping in view the natural calamities that occur from time to time

scheme_name: Assistance Program for the Cultivation of Lotus Fruit (Dragon Fruit)
brief_description: The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers to support the cultivation of dragon fruit (lotus fruit), with higher benefits for SC/ST and priority for small-scale and women farmers.
full_description: The scheme &quot;Assistance Program for the Cultivation of Lotus Fruit (Dragon Fruit)&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to promote horticultural farming by supporting farmers with financial aid for the initial infrastructure and planting costs involved in dragon fruit cultivation.
eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer.
The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
The applicant must have a minimum land between 0.20 ha and 1 ha.
The applicant must procure quality planting materials from a nursery and start the plantation.
> **Note:** Preference will be given to small-scale and women farmers.
benefits: **General category:** 50% assistance or up to ₹3,00,000/- per hectare (whichever is less).- **SC/ST** **category:**  75% assistance or up to ₹4,50,000/- per hectare (whichever is less).
> **First Year Assistance:**

**Cement pole/pipe:** 1111 units at ₹300 each = ₹3,33,300/-- **Planting material:** 4444 units at ₹35 each = ₹1,55,540/-- **Total:** ₹4,88,840/-- **Actual Assistance Provided:** 50% or up to ₹2,44,420/-, whichever is less.
> **Second Year Assistance:**
**Head ring or Trellising & wire (approx. 400 kg)**: ₹1,11,160/-- **Actual Assistance Provided:** 50% or up to ₹55,580/-, whichever is less.

scheme_name: Scheme to Encourage Farmers to Add Value to Crops
brief_description: The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers across Gujarat in adding value to their crops by providing financial assistance for purchasing machinery.
full_description: The &quot;Scheme to Encourage Farmers to Add Value to Crops&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to promote value addition in agriculture by helping farmers invest in machinery and equipment. This initiative seeks to improve the profitability of farming by supporting post-harvest processing and mechanization.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a farmer.
1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
1. The applicant must be involved in agriculture-related activities.
1.  The applicant must intend to purchase machinery for value addition.
benefits: **Financial Assistance:** 50% of the machinery cost or ₹10,00,000/-, whichever is less.

scheme_name: Assistance for Power Driven Chaff Cutter scheme
brief_description: The "Assistance for Power Driven Chaff Cutter Scheme" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, is designed to help farmers reduce fodder wastage and improve their dairy farming efficiency.
eligibility: The scheme is applicable to General, Scheduled Caste (SC), and Scheduled Tribe (ST) individuals.
The applicant must be engaged in dairy farming.
benefits: **Name of Component** **Standard of Assistance** **Minimum Time Limit(In Year) for Reclaiming Benefits** Assistance for Power Driven Chaff Cutter scheme under General People, Schedule Caste People and Schedule Tribe People. Assistance up to 75% of the purchase cost or ₹18,000/- whichever is less is given to beneficiary.5 Year

This initiative seeks to improve the profitability of farming by supporting post-harvest processing and mechanization.

1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
1. The applicant must be involved in agriculture-related activities.
1.  The applicant must intend to purchase machinery for value addition.

scheme_name: Mukhyamantri Matsya Sampada Yojana
brief_description: The scheme aims to enhance fish production, generate employment opportunities, and improve the livelihoods of fish farmers by providing free training, field visits, and seminars on various fisheries-related activities.
full_description: The “Mukhyamantri Matsya Sampada Yojana” was introduced by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to enhance fish production, generate employment opportunities, and improve the livelihoods of fish farmers by providing free training, field visits, and seminars on various fisheries-related activities.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant should have availability of land and a water supply source or should already be engaged in fish farming.
1. All individuals/applicants belonging to any caste category in Uttarakhand are eligible to avail the benefits under this scheme.
benefits: Under this scheme, assistance is provided to small and large farmers/women engaged in various activities or items related to the fisheries sector, as mentioned in the table below**.**

**Training, field visits, and seminars are provided to fish farmers free of cost.**

scheme_name: Solar Water Heating System (Domestic Sector)
brief_description: The scheme "Solar Water Heating System (Domestic Sector)" by the Renewable Energy Department, Haryana, aims to promote the use of solar energy for domestic water heating by providing a financial subsidy to the residents of Haryana and Haryana Government employees residing in Chandigarh.
full_description: The scheme &quot;Solar Water Heating System (Domestic Sector)&quot; implemented by the Renewable Energy Department, Government of Haryana, aims to promote renewable energy usage and reduce dependence on conventional heating methods by providing financial subsidies to encourage the installation of solar water heating systems in the domestic sector. It also seeks to reduce electricity and fuel bills and promote environmentally sustainable solutions for households.
eligibility: 1. Any resident family of Haryana.
1. Government employees of Haryana residing in Chandigarh.
benefits: **Subsidy :** ₹10,000/- per 100 LPD (Maximum ₹30,000/-) for FPC system and ₹3,000/- per 100 LPD (Maximum ₹9,000/-) is being provided.

scheme_name: PMMSY: Ice Plant/Cold Store of Minimum 20-Ton Capacity - Haryana
brief_description: The subsidy for 20-ton capacity ice plant/cold storage units under Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) supports the establishment of ice plants or cold storage facilities with a minimum capacity of 20 tons to improve fish preservation and cold chain infrastructure in Haryana.
full_description: The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Ice Plant/Cold Store of minimum 20-ton capacity, introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide the subsidy for 20-ton capacity ice plant/cold storage units, supports the establishment of ice plants or cold storage facilities with a minimum capacity of 20 tons to improve fish preservation and cold chain infrastructure in Haryana. This centrally sponsored scheme is jointly funded 50% by the Central Government and 50% by the State Government. Beneficiaries must submit an undertaking in their DPR agreeing to keep the unit operational, cover all post-construction costs, and supply ice to fishers and fish farmers at affordable prices.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Haryana and possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).

1. The applicant must submit an undertaking in the DPR to bear all operational, maintenance, and post-construction management costs, and to ensure the continuous functioning of the ice plant/cold storage.
1. The applicant must note that central assistance will be provided as per the actual cost, subject to the ceiling limits under relevant PMMSY sub-components.
1. The applicant must ensure that the ice produced is supplied to fishers and fish farmers at an affordable price.
1. The applicant must either own the project land or hold it on a long-term registered lease of at least 10 years to be eligible.
benefits: The project cost is ₹80,00,000/
> **Subsidy Distribution :**
1. A 40% subsidy is available for the General Category.
1. A 60% subsidy is offered for SC (Scheduled Caste) and Women beneficiaries.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Medium Fish Feed Mill of Production Capacity of 8 Ton/Day
brief_description: The scheme aims to promote fish feed self-sufficiency and affordability among fish farmers. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided for setting up medium-sized fish feed mills with a production capacity of 8 tons per day, benefiting entrepreneurs and fish farmers.
full_description: The “Medium Fish Feed Mill of Production Capacity of 8 Ton/Day” is a scheme component under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY), implemented by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. This is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme, aims to promote fish feed self-sufficiency and affordability among fish farmers. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided for setting up medium-sized fish feed mills with a production capacity of 8 tons per day, benefiting entrepreneurs and fish farmers.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Haryana.
1. The applicant should possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (Family ID).
1. The applicant should ensure that the medium fish feed mill is in working condition.
1. The applicant should ensure the feed produced from the unit is supplied at affordable price to fishers and farmers.
1. The fish feed mill should be on land owned by the applicant or on a long-term registered lease (minimum of 10 years).
benefits: **Tangible Benefits:**
Financial assistance for setting up a fish feed mill of 8 tons/day capacity.
Unit cost is ₹1,00,00,000/- per unit.
40% subsidy of the project cost for General Category beneficiaries (up to ₹40,00,000/-).
60% subsidy of the project cost for Weaker sections/ SC/ST/Women and their co-operatives of beneficiaries (up to ₹60,00,000/-).

scheme_name: PMMSY: Ice Plant/Cold Store of minimum 10-ton capacity Haryana
brief_description: The subsidy for 10-ton capacity ice plant/cold storage units under Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) supports the establishment of ice plants or cold storage facilities with a minimum capacity of 10 tons to improve fish preservation and cold chain infrastructure in Haryana.
full_description: The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Ice Plant/Cold Store of minimum 10-ton capacity, introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide the subsidy to support the establishment of ice plants or cold storage facilities with a minimum capacity of 10 tons to improve fish preservation and cold chain infrastructure in Haryana. This centrally sponsored scheme is jointly funded 50% by the Central Government and 50% by the State Government. Eligible beneficiaries must undertake to keep the unit operational, cover maintenance and post-construction costs, and ensure ice is supplied to fishers and fish farmers at affordable prices.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Haryana and possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
1. The applicant must submit an undertaking in the DPR agreeing to bear all operational, maintenance, and post-construction costs.
1. The applicant must ensure that the ice plant/cold storage remains continuously operational.
1. The applicant must ensure that the ice produced is supplied to fishers and fish farmers at affordable prices.
1. The applicant must either own the land or have it on a long-term registered lease of at least 10 years.
1. The applicant must note that central assistance will be provided based on actual costs, within the overall ceiling limits specified under PMMSY sub-components.
1. The applicant must understand that, upon approval, the subsidy will be disbursed as per the procedure laid out under PMMSY.
benefits: The project cost is ₹40,00,000/
> **Subsidy Distribution :**
1. A 40% subsidy is available for the General Category.
1. A 60% subsidy is offered for SC (Scheduled Caste) and Women beneficiaries.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Motor Cycle with Ice Box - Haryana
brief_description: The scheme aims to strengthen fish transportation infrastructure and ensure the freshness and quality of fish during transit. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to fishers for purchasing motorcycles equipped with ice boxes, ensuring efficient and hygienic fish transport.
full_description: The “Motor Cycle with Ice Box” is a scheme component under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY), implemented by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. This is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme, aims to strengthen fish transportation infrastructure and ensure the freshness and quality of fish during transit. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to fishers for purchasing motorcycles equipped with ice boxes, ensuring efficient and hygienic fish transport.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Haryana.
1. The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra.
1. The applicant should ensure that fish transport facilities are maintained in operational condition.
1. The applicant will be eligible for a subsidy for the purchase of only motorcycle with ice box.
1. The applicant should utilize the vehicle solely for fishery-related transportation activities.
1. The Government of India and the Government of Haryana will not be responsible for any loss incurred in the purchase, operation, maintenance, and management of fish transport facilities.
benefits: **Financial Assistance provided under the scheme:**
Project Cost: ₹75,000/- per unit
Subsidy will be limited to 40% of the project cost for the General Category of beneficiaries.
Subsidy will be limited to 60% of the project cost for Weaker sections/Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe/Women and their co-operatives of beneficiaries.

scheme_name: PMMSY: Ice Plant/Cold Storage of Minimum 50-Ton Capacity - Haryana
brief_description: This scheme provides financial assistance for setting up ice plants or cold storage units with a minimum capacity of 50 tons, supporting cold chain infrastructure under PMMSY.
full_description: The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Ice Plant/Cold Storage of Minimum 50-Ton Capacity , introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide financial assistance for setting up ice plants or cold storage units with a minimum capacity of 50 tons, supporting cold chain infrastructure under PMMSY. The aim is to reduce post-harvest losses and improve fish quality. This is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme, funded in the ratio of: 50% by the Central Government, and 50% by the State Government. The beneficiary must operate and maintain the plant and ensure supply of ice to fishers at affordable prices.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Haryana and possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
1. The applicant must own land or hold a registered lease for a minimum period of 10 years.
1. The applicant must submit an undertaking within the DPR/SCP, accepting full responsibility for operating and maintaining the unit.
1. The applicant must provide ice at affordable prices to fishers.
1. The applicant must submit a Detailed Project Report (DPR) or Self-Contained Proposal (SCP) in accordance with PMMSY guidelines.
1. The applicant must hold a valid training certificate in ice plant or cold storage operation and maintenance.
1. The applicant must ensure the land is free from legal issues and must provide a valid land title.
benefits: The project cost is ₹150,00,000/
****   **Subsidy Distribution:**
1. A 40% subsidy is available for the General Category.
1. A 60% subsidy is offered for SC (Scheduled Caste) and Women beneficiaries.

scheme_name: PMMSY: Large Fish Feed Mill of Production Capacity of 20 Ton /Day Scheme - Haryana
brief_description: The scheme aims to strengthen aquaculture through fish feed production. It provides a grant per unit to the beneficiaries under PMMSY.
full_description: The "Large Fish Feed Mill with Production Capacity of 20 Ton/Per Day" scheme was launched by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY), it aims to strengthen post-harvest infrastructure and enhance fish feed production to support sustainable aquaculture. Under this scheme, a grant is provided to beneficiaries for setting up a large fish feed mill, with 40% subsidy for general category and 60% for Scheduled Caste/Women beneficiaries.
eligibility: 1. Beneficiary must have Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).

1. The Beneficiaries will submit an undertaking in the DPR to the effect that all operational, maintenance and post construction management costs of the infrastructure facilities will be borne by them and the Fish Feed Plant will be kept in operational condition.
1. Central assistance for Fish Feed Mill will be as per actual cost within the overall ceiling indicated in the respective sub-components/activities under PMMSY.
1. The Beneficiary will ensure supply of feed produced from the government assisted Fish Feed Plant to the fishers and fish farmers at affordable price.

1. The projects having land on long term registered lease shall also be considered for Central financial assistance under the scheme. However, the registered lease period/agreement shall not be less than a minimum period of 10 (ten) years.
benefits: **Monetary Assistance:**
Grant of ₹20,00,000/- per unit for establishing a fish feed mill with 20-ton/day capacity.
**Subsidy Provisions:**
40% subsidy on unit cost for General Category beneficiaries.
60% subsidy on unit cost for Scheduled Caste and women beneficiaries.

scheme_name: PMMSY: Insulated Vehicles - Haryana
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide a subsidy per unit for purchasing insulated vehicles for the beneficiaries to promote cold-chain logistics in fish transportation.
full_description: The "Insulated Vehicle" scheme was launched by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, under the umbrella scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana". It aims to promote efficient and hygienic fish transportation systems. Under this scheme, a financial grant is provided to the beneficiaries for purchasing insulated (reefer) vehicles used in fish transportation. It seeks to minimize post-harvest losses, improve fish value chains, and enhance earnings of fish farmers by enabling cold-chain logistics.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a fish farmer.
1. The applicant must possess a Family Identity Card (Parivar Pehchan Patra).
1. The applicant must ensure that the fish transportation facility is maintained in working condition.
1. The applicant must not have availed a grant for a similar insulated (reefer) vehicle earlier.
benefits: **Financial Assistance:**
Financial grant of up to ₹20,00,000/- per unit for the purchase of an insulated (reefer) vehicle.
**Grant Limits:**
40% of the unit cost for general category beneficiaries.
60% of the unit cost for Scheduled Caste (SC) and women beneficiaries.
> **Note**
Subsidy is applicable for one vehicle per beneficiary only.
Central assistance is released only after initiating fishery activity.
The applicant should agree that any losses in procurement, operation, or maintenance are their own responsibility, and not that of the Government of India or Haryana.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Mini Fish Feed Mills of Production Capacity of 2 Ton /Day
brief_description: Under this scheme, financial assistance, in form of subsidy, is provided to individuals for setting up mini feed mills, ensuring the local availability of quality fish feed at affordable prices for fishers and fish farmers.
full_description: The “Mini Fish Feed Mills of Production Capacity of 2 Ton /Day” is a scheme component under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY), implemented by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. This is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme, aims to strengthen inland aquaculture infrastructure by promoting the establishment of small-scale fish feed mills. Under this scheme, financial assistance, in form of subsidy, is provided to individuals for setting up mini feed mills, ensuring the local availability of quality fish feed at affordable prices for fishers and fish farmers.
eligibility: 1. The applicant/beneficiary should be a resident of Haryana.
1. The applicant should possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (Family ID).
1. All operational, maintenance, and post-construction management costs of the infrastructure facilities shall be borne by the beneficiary.
1. The beneficiary should ensure that the Fish Feed Mill remains in functional condition.
1. The beneficiary should supply the feed produced from the government-assisted Fish Feed Mill/Plant to fishers and fish farmers at an affordable price.
1. The applicant should either own the land or have it on a registered lease agreement valid for a minimum of 10 years.
benefits: **Tangible Benefits:**
Project Cost: ₹30,00,000/- per unit
Subsidy will be limited to 40% of the project cost for General Category of beneficiaries.
Subsidy will be limited to 60% of the project cost for Weaker sections/ SC/ST/Women and their co-operatives of beneficiaries.

scheme_name: Intensive Fisheries Development Programme - Subsidy on Insurance Premium for Shrimp Crop Insurance
brief_description: The scheme aims to promote sustainable aquaculture by reducing financial risk of shrimp farmers through subsidized insurance coverage.Under this scheme, a 50% subsidy is provided on insurance premium paid by eligible fish farmers for shrimp crop insurance, helping them mitigate potential crop losses
full_description: The “Subsidy on Insurance Premium for Shrimp Crop Insurance” is a scheme component under the Intensive Fisheries Development Programme, implemented by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. The scheme aims to promote sustainable aquaculture by reducing the financial risk of shrimp farmers through subsidized insurance coverage. Under this scheme, a 50% subsidy is provided on the insurance premium paid by eligible fish farmers for shrimp crop insurance, helping them mitigate potential crop losses.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
1. The applicant should be a farmer and involved in shrimp farming.
1. The applicant should possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP ID).
1. The applicant should be at least 18 years of age.
benefits: 50% subsidy on the insurance premium paid for shrimp crop insurance.
exclusions: The applicant must not be a Government/ Semi-Government employee.

scheme_name: Pashu Palan Yojana (GTKVN)
brief_description: The scheme aims to enhance the livelihoods of Thakor and Koli communities by providing financial assistance for animal husbandry activities such as dairy farming. Under this scheme, loans of up to ₹1,00,000/- are provided for the purchase of milch animals such as cows and buffaloes.
full_description: The "Pashu Palan Yojana" is implemented by the Gujarat Thakor and Koli Vikas Nigam (GTKVN) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to strengthen the livelihoods of the Thakor and Koli communities by providing financial support for animal husbandry activities, such as dairy farming with cows and buffaloes. Under this scheme, loans are offered to purchase milch animals like cows and buffaloes, thereby promoting sustainable self-employment in agriculture-related sectors.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.
1. The applicant should belong to Thakor or Koli community.
1. The applicant’s annual family income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-.
1. The applicant's age should be between 21 to 50 years.
1. The applicant should intend to purchase cows, buffaloes, or related dairy equipment for self‑employment.
benefits: The maximum loan limit under this scheme is up to ₹1,00,000/-.
The loan is provided for animal husbandry activities such as dairy farming, boosting rural self-employment.

scheme_name: Scheme for the Welfare of Schedule Caste Families in Fisheries Sector: Subsidy on 1st Year Lease Money
brief_description: The objective of the scheme is to provide full-time employment to individuals from Scheduled Caste families in the fisheries sector and to uplift these families by promoting fish farming through financial assistance for leasing Panchayati ponds or watershed areas.
full_description: The “Subsidy on 1st Year Lease Money” is a scheme component under the Scheme for the Welfare of Scheduled Caste Families in the Fisheries Sector, launched by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. The objective of the scheme is to provide full-time employment to individuals from Scheduled Caste families in the fisheries sector and to uplift these families by promoting fish farming through financial assistance for leasing Panchayati ponds or watershed areas. Under this scheme, a subsidy is provided to Scheduled Caste beneficiaries to partially cover the lease cost, thereby reducing the financial burden during the initial stages of aquaculture.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
1. The applicant should possess a valid Family ID Card (Parivar Pehchan Patra).
1. The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Caste category.
1. The applicant's age should be 18 years or above.
1. The pond lease period should not be less than 5 years.
1. The maximum area eligible for subsidy is 4 hectares per applicant.
1. The subsidy is applicable only on Panchayati ponds and government water sheds.
benefits: ***Financial Assistance:***
50% of the actual lease amount OR ₹50,000/- per hectare, whichever is less.
The subsidy is applicable for a maximum of 4 hectares per beneficiary.
exclusions: 1. The applicant should not be a Government/ Semi Government employee.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland): Establishment of Large RAS Culture System Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme provides financial assistance for various inland fisheries activities, including the establishment of large Recirculating Aquaculture Systems (RAS), and is provided to individuals, societies, self-help groups, associations, reservoir leaseholders, and private entities.
full_description:
The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland)" with the component of the Establishment of Large RAS (with 8 tanks of minimum 90 m3/ tank capacity 40 tonnes/ crop) Culture System, introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to people involved in inland fisheries activities. Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided for various inland fisheries activities, including the establishment of large Recirculating Aquaculture Systems (RAS). The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries of the State Governments, with 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% from the Government of Gujarat.
> **Objective:** - Assistance is provided for accelerating inland fish farming activities in freshwater bodies, increasing inland fish production and boosting inland fisheries. - Except for water bodies or ponds, in less land, less water, Biofloc with source as well, Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS). By creating fish tanks with this method, more fish production can be obtained in less land and less water. If more beneficiaries get the benefit of the subsidy of this scheme, more fish production can be achieved with less water sources and less land. - Inland fish production capacity can be increased by the establishment of freshwater hatcheries.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be an individual, society, self-help group, association, reservoir lease holder, or private entity involved in inland fisheries activities.
1. The applicant must be above 18 years of age.
1. The applicant must have their own bank account.

1. The applicant must have their own private land or a minimum 10-year lease agreement for land to avail construction-related assistance on land. In case of co-owners, the consent form of co-owners must be submitted.
1. The applicant must have a Voter ID/Ration Card/Aadhar Card/Passport as proof of identity.
> **Preference/Priority/Reservation/Relaxation:**
All categories (General, Women, Scheduled Caste, and Scheduled Tribe) will receive benefits under the Inland Schemes.
Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries are required to have a Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe certificate to avail benefits under the inland components.
benefits: Assistance is provided for the establishment of a Large Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS) with 8 tanks of a minimum 90 m3/tank capacity, targeting 40 tonnes/crop production.
The unit cost for this component is ₹50,00,000/- per unit.
For the General Category, the scale of assistance is 40% of the unit cost or 40% of the actual cost, whichever is less.
For Women, Scheduled Castes (SC), and Scheduled Tribes (ST) categories, the scale of assistance is 60% of the unit cost or 60% of the actual cost, whichever is less.
> **Mode of Disbursement:** 60% of the government contribution is from the Government of India, and 40% is from the State Government.
> **Frequency of Disbursement**: The minimum time limit for reclaiming benefits is specified as "Once in a lifetime".

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland): Establishment of Medium RAS Culture System Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme aims to enhance fish production and create employment through sustainable inland fisheries. It provides financial support to eligible beneficiaries for setting up medium-scale RAS units.
full_description:
The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland)" with a component Establishment of Medium RAS (with 6 tanks of minimum 30m3/tank capacity 10t/crop) Culture System, introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to people involved in inland fisheries activities. Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided to individuals and entities for the establishment of Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS) based medium-scale fish tanks using limited land and water resources. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries of the State Governments, with 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% from the Government of Gujarat.
> **Objective:** - Assistance is provided for accelerating inland fish farming activities in freshwater bodies, increasing inland fish production and boosting inland fisheries. - Except for water bodies or ponds, in less land, less water, Biofloc with source as well, Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS). By creating fish tanks with this method, more fish production can be obtained in less land and less water. If more beneficiaries get the benefit of the subsidy of this scheme, more fish production can be achieved with less water sources and less land. - Inland fish production capacity can be increased by the establishment of freshwater hatcheries.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be an individual, society, self-help group, association, reservoir lease holder, or private entity involved in inland fisheries activities.
1. The applicant must be above 18 years of age.
1. The applicant must have their own bank account.

1. The applicant must have their own private land or a minimum 10-year lease agreement for land to avail construction-related assistance on land. In case of co-owners, the consent form of co-owners must be submitted.
1. The applicant must have a Voter ID/Ration Card/Aadhar Card/Passport as proof of identity.
> **Preference/Priority/Reservation/Relaxation:**
All categories (General, Women, Scheduled Caste, and Scheduled Tribe) will receive benefits under the Inland Schemes.
Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries are required to have a Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe certificate to avail benefits under the inland components.
benefits: The scheme provides assistance for the establishment of a Medium Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS) with 6 tanks of a minimum 30m3/tank capacity (10t/crop).
> **Financial Assistance:**
The unit cost for this component is ₹25,00,000/- per unit.
General Category: 40% of the unit cost or 40% of the actual cost, whichever is less, is paid as subsidy.
Female/Scheduled Caste (SC)/Scheduled Tribe (ST) Category: 60% of the unit cost or 40% of the actual cost, whichever is less, is paid as subsidy.
> **Frequency of Disbursement:** The benefit for the establishment of a Medium RAS (with 6 tanks of minimum 30m3/tank capacity 10t/crop) culture system (PMMSY) can be reclaimed once in a lifetime.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland): Establishment of Back-Yard Mini RAS Unit Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme aims to enhance inland fish production and create employment. It provides subsidies to eligible beneficiaries for fish hatchery and RAS unit establishment.
full_description:
The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland)" with the component of Establishment of Back-Yard Mini RAS Unit, introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to increase fish production by promoting inland fisheries and creating employment opportunities through rearing fish in reservoirs. Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided to eligible individuals and entities involved in inland fisheries for the establishment of fish hatcheries and fish farming units using advanced technologies such as Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS) and Biofloc. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries of the State Governments, with 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% from the Government of Gujarat.
> **Objective:** - Assistance is provided for accelerating inland fish farming activities in freshwater bodies, increasing inland fish production and boosting inland fisheries. - Except for water bodies or ponds, in less land, less water, Biofloc with source as well, Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS). By creating fish tanks with this method, more fish production can be obtained in less land and less water. If more beneficiaries get the benefit of the subsidy of this scheme, more fish production can be achieved with less water sources and less land. - Inland fish production capacity can be increased by the establishment of freshwater hatcheries.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be an individual, society, self-help group, association, reservoir lease holder, or private entity involved in inland fisheries activities.
1. The applicant must be above 18 years of age.
1. The applicant must have their own bank account.

1. The applicant must have their own private land or a minimum 10-year lease agreement for land to avail construction-related assistance on land. In case of co-owners, the consent form of co-owners must be submitted.
1. The applicant must have a Voter ID/Ration Card/Aadhar Card/Passport as proof of identity.
> **Preference/Priority/Reservation/Relaxation:**
All categories (General, Women, Scheduled Caste, and Scheduled Tribe) will receive benefits under the Inland Schemes.
Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries are required to have a Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe certificate to avail benefits under the inland components.
benefits: The scheme provides assistance for the establishment of Back-Yard Mini Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS) units.
> **Financial Assistance:**
The unit cost for this component is ₹50,000/- per unit.

**General Category:** 40% of the unit cost or 40% of the actual cost, whichever is less, is paid as a subsidy.- **Female/Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) Categories:** 60% of the unit cost or 40% of the actual cost, whichever is less, is paid as a subsidy.
> **Mode of Disbursement:** The assistance is paid with 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% contribution from the State Government.
> **Frequency of Disbursement:** Once in a lifetime.

scheme_name: Sub mission on Seeds and Planting Material
brief_description: The scheme aims to increase the production of certified/quality seed; strengthen Seed Testing Laboratories; assist Seed Producing Institutes for the adoption of new technologies, ensuring farmers get quality seeds at the right time and reasonable prices.
full_description:
The scheme "Sub-mission on Seeds and Planting Material" by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to achieve several key objectives. Through this scheme, assistance for seed distribution, strengthening of seed quality control laboratories, and creation of seed infrastructure facilities are provided to all categories of farmers, State Agricultural Universities (SAUs), Farmers' Producer Organisations (FPOs), Co-operative enterprises, and Government enterprises.
> **Objective of Scheme:** - Increasing production of certified/quality seed - Strengthening Seed Testing Laboratories - Assisting Seed Producing Institutes for the adoption of new technologies, ensuring farmers get quality seeds at the right time and at reasonable prices - Development of infrastructure for seed industries - Improving seed quality - Enhancing capacity building for seed production - Creation of a Seed Bank for adverse natural calamities
eligibility: 1. The applicant must belong to one of the following categories: all categories of farmers, State Agricultural Universities (SAUs), Farmers' Producer Organisations (FPOs), Co-operative enterprises, or Government enterprises.
1. The applicant must attach land records along with the application form.
1. The applicant must have their own bank account.
benefits: > **Seed Village Programme:**

Assistance will be provided for the distribution of foundation and certified seed required for a 1-acre area for cereal crops; the assistance covers 50% of the cost, and for pulse, oilseeds, green manure & fodder crops, the assistance covers 60% of the cost.
Validity: The maximum time limit for reclaiming benefits is 2 years.
> **Strengthening of Seed Quality Control Laboratories:**
Assistance is provided on a project basis.
Intended Use: For State Agricultural Universities (SAUs), Farmers' Producer Organisations (FPOs), Co-operative enterprises, and Government enterprises.
Frequency of Disbursement: One time.
> **Creation of Seed Infrastructure Facility (SPP):**
Assistance is provided on a project basis.

scheme_name: Mission for Integrated Horticulture Development (MIDH)
brief_description: The scheme "Mission for Integrated Horticulture Development (MIDH)" is a centrally sponsored scheme that aims to promote growth in the horticulture sector through financial and technical support to farmers for cultivation, post-harvest management, and market linkage development.
full_description: The scheme "Mission for Integrated Horticulture Development (MIDH)" is a centrally sponsored scheme that aims to ensure the holistic development of horticulture by providing financial assistance and technical support to farmers for the cultivation of fruits, vegetables, spices, flowers, and other horticultural crops, along with promoting modern technologies, post-harvest management, and value addition. The scheme promotes cluster planting, renovation of old gardens, use of advanced technologies such as protected cultivation, integrated pest and nutrient management, and horticultural mechanization to enhance production and sustainability in alignment with regional agro-climatic conditions.
eligibility: The applicant should be a farmer
The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.
The applicant should intend to cultivate horticultural crops or undertake related activities.
benefits: **Crop Development and Production:** Support programs are provided for planting and increasing the production of diverse horticultural crops, including fruits, vegetables, pepper, spices, and flower crops, tailored to different regions and agro-climates within the state.  - **Technological Promotion:** The scheme promotes and extends the use of modern technology in horticulture.  - **Propagation Support:** Support programs are available for grafting and stem raising, contributing to better crop propagation.  - **Post-Harvest Management and Value Addition:** Assistance is provided for post-harvest management processes and value addition initiatives, ensuring better returns for produce.  - **Market System Development:** Financial assistance is extended to individuals and the private sector for the development of collection and market systems, aiming for comprehensive growth in horticulture.  - **Specific Component Inclusion:** The scheme primarily includes components such as- Cluster planting of new fruit, flower, vegetable, aromatic, and spice crops; Renovation of old gardens; Horticultural mechanization; Integrated fertilizer pest control management; Protected cultivation for horticultural crops; Mulching and the use of bird nets, etc.

scheme_name: Provide Assistance to Farmers Bringing Goods to Market Committees for Cost of Goods Transportation (Tribal)
brief_description: The scheme "Provide Assistance to Farmers Bringing Goods to Market Committees for Cost of Goods Transportation (Tribal)" aims to encourage tribal farmers to bring their produce to market committees by providing financial assistance towards transportation costs.
full_description: The scheme "Provide Assistance to Farmers Bringing Goods to Market Committees for Cost of Goods Transportation (Tribal)" by the Agriculture and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote the participation of tribal farmers in formal agricultural markets by reimbursing transportation costs incurred while bringing agricultural goods to market committees. The primary objective is to reduce the financial burden of logistics on tribal farmers and thereby enhance their income through better market access and fair price realization.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a tribal farmer.
1. The applicant should be residing in a tribal area of Gujarat.
1. The applicant should bring their agricultural produce to a registered market committee (APMC) located in the tribal area.
1. The applicant should be the owner or cultivator of the agricultural goods transported.
benefits: **Financial Assistance:** ₹500/- per tonne of agricultural produce transported. Assistance is available for up to 10 tonnes per farmer, which amounts to a maximum of ₹5,000/-.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland): Inputs for Freshwater Aquaculture - Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme aims to increase inland fish production and employment through reservoir-based fish farming. The scheme offers financial assistance to individuals and groups via the iKhedut portal.
full_description:
The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY – Inland)" with the component of Inputs for Freshwater Aquaculture (Including Composite Fish Culture, Scampi, Pagasius, Tilapia) introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries of the State Governments, with 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% from the Government of Gujarat.
> **Objective:** - Increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to people involved in inland fisheries activities - Assistance is provided for accelerating inland fish farming activities in freshwater bodies, increasing inland fish production and boosting inland fisheries. - Except for water bodies or ponds, in less land, less water, Biofloc with source as well, Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS). By creating fish tanks with this method, more fish production can be obtained in less land and less water. If more beneficiaries get the benefit of the subsidy of this scheme, more fish production can be achieved with less water sources and less land. - Inland fish production capacity can be increased by the establishment of freshwater hatcheries.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be an individual, society, self-help group, association, reservoir lease holder, or private entity involved in inland fisheries activities.
1. The applicant must be above 18 years of age.
1. The applicant must have their own bank account.

1. The applicant must have their own private land or a minimum 10-year lease agreement for land to avail construction-related assistance on land. In case of co-owners, the consent form of co-owners must be submitted.
1. The applicant must have a Voter ID/Ration Card/Aadhar Card/Passport as proof of identity.
> **Preference/Priority/Reservation/Relaxation:**
All categories (General, Women, Scheduled Caste, and Scheduled Tribe) will receive benefits under the Inland Schemes.
Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries are required to have a Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe certificate to avail benefits under the inland components.
benefits: 1. The unit cost of the project for Inputs for Freshwater Aquaculture (Including Composite Fish Culture, Scampi, Pangasius, and Tilapia) is ₹4,00,000/-.
1. Beneficiaries in the general category receive 40% of the unit cost as assistance.
1. Women, Scheduled Caste (SC), and Scheduled Tribe (ST) beneficiaries receive 60% of the unit cost as assistance.
1. The subsidy is jointly funded: 60% by the Government of India and 40% by the Government of Gujarat.

> **Mode of Disbursement:** Assistance is paid with a 60% contribution from the Government of India and a 40% contribution from the State Governments (specifically, the Government of Gujarat as mentioned in the provided text).
> **Validity:** A minimum time limit of 1 year is set for reclaiming benefits.

scheme_name: Assistance to Co-operative Irrigation Societies (Trible Area)
brief_description: The scheme "Assistance to Co-operative Irrigation Societies (Tribal Area)" aims to enhance agricultural productivity by financially supporting co-operative irrigation societies in tribal areas through the installation of water distribution infrastructure.
full_description: The scheme "Assistance to Co-operative Irrigation Societies (Tribal Area)" by the Agriculture and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to increase farm productivity by offering financial support to irrigation co-operative societies formed by tribal area farmers. The scheme focuses on forming such societies and facilitating water distribution by setting up electric pumps and motors on wells and agar creeks.
eligibility: Cooperative irrigation societies formed by small and marginal farmers, or any other farmers, are eligible under this scheme.
The society should be located within the state of Gujarat.
The Scheme is applicable to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category.
benefits: **Monetary Support:** Financial help is provided for the installation of electric motors and pumps on wells and agar creeks to enhance irrigation facilities.

scheme_name: AGR-4 Scheduled Castes Sub-Plan for Distribution of Seeds and Fertilizers Input Kits at Subsidised Rates to Scheduled Caste Cultivators
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide subsidised seeds, fertilizers, and organic inputs to Scheduled Caste farmers to improve agricultural productivity.
full_description: The scheme "AGR-4 Scheduled Castes Sub-Plan for Distribution of Seeds and Fertilizers Input Kits at Subsidised Rates to Scheduled Caste Cultivators" by the Agriculture and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to support Scheduled Caste cultivators by providing agricultural input kits at subsidised rates for enhancing soil fertility and improving crop yield. The main objective of the scheme is to strengthen the farming practices of Scheduled Caste farmers by making available critical resources such as castor cake, neem cake, liquid fermented organic manure, or green manure seeds at concessional rates. Beneficiaries can avail these inputs for cultivation on a maximum of 2 hectares per account, ensuring equitable distribution and wider coverage.
eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer.
The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste category.
benefits: **Subsidized Rates:** SC farmers receive essential agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers at significantly reduced costs.  - **Access to Quality Inputs:** The scheme ensures farmers have access to high-quality minor and micro-elements, castor cake, neem cake, liquid fermented organic manure, or green manure seeds.  - **Reduced Cultivation Costs:** By providing subsidized inputs, the scheme lowers the overall cost of cultivation, helping to improve the economic viability of farming for SC cultivators.

scheme_name: Distribution of Seeds of more productions varieties/ Hybrids varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area: 100% Soluble Chemical Fertilizer/Nano Fertilizer Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme aims to help Adivasi farmers and tribal cultivators increase crop production and improve their livelihood. Through this scheme, subsidies are provided for various agricultural inputs and equipment such as seeds, fertilizers, plant protection equipment, and pump sets.
full_description: The scheme "Distribution of Seeds of more productive varieties / Hybrid varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies, etc,. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area (TASP)" with a component "100% Soluble Chemical Fertilizer/Nano Fertilizer" is introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to assist Adivasi and Scheduled Tribe farmers in tribal and non-tribal areas to achieve higher agricultural production and improve their livelihoods. Through this scheme, subsidies are provided on items such as seeds of more productive/hybrid varieties, fertilizers, plant protection equipment, tarpaulins, micronutrients, water carrying pipelines, and pump sets.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Tribe.
1. The applicant should be a farmer.
1. The applicant should be located in tribal areas OR be a tribal cultivator residing outside tribal areas.
1. The scheme excludes farmers from Dang district.
benefits: > **100% Soluble Chemical Fertilizer/Nano Fertilizer:**

100% soluble chemical fertilizers/nano-fertilizers of FCO-approved grade subject to 75% of the purchase price or ₹ 750/- per hectare, will be eligible for subsidy. (subject to a maximum of four hectares per account)
> **Remark:** As per conditions No. 5, 16, 17, 19 and 22 of [Appendix-1](https://mariyojana.gujarat.gov.in/Schemeatoz.aspx). (Refer Scheme No. 35).
> **Frequency:** Every year.

scheme_name: Distribution of Seeds of more productions varieties/ Hybrids varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area: Plant protection pesticides Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme aims to help Scheduled Tribe farmers and tribal cultivators residing outside tribal areas achieve higher agricultural crop production and improve their livelihood. Through this scheme, various tools and practices are provided to the farmers at subsidised rates.
full_description: The scheme "Distribution of Seeds of more productive varieties / Hybrid varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies, etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area (TASP)" with a component "Plant protection pesticides" is introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to help Scheduled Tribe farmers and tribal cultivators residing outside tribal areas achieve higher agricultural crop production and improve their livelihood. Through this scheme, assistance is provided for various components, including plant protection pesticides, which, when used according to scientific recommendations, can significantly increase crop production.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Tribe.
1. The applicant should be a farmer.
1. The applicant should be located in tribal areas OR be a tribal cultivator residing outside tribal areas.
1. The scheme excludes farmers from Dang district.
benefits: 1. 75% of the purchase price or ₹ 750/- per hectare, whichever is lower (subject to a maximum of two hectares per account)
> **Remarks**: According to conditions No. 5, 16, 17, 19 and 22 of Appendix-1, crop protection drugs included under Pesticides Act-1968 have to be given.
> Biological/herbal medicines are to be preferred.
> **Frequency:****** Every year.
> **Note:**  **For** [**Appendix-1**](https://mariyojana.gujarat.gov.in/Schemeatoz.aspx)**. (Refer to Scheme No. 35)**

scheme_name: National Mission For Sustainable Agriculture-Parmparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (NMSA-PKVY)
brief_description: The scheme "National Mission For Sustainable Agriculture-Parmparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (NMSA-PKVY)" is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme that aims to promote organic farming practices through providing financial assistance for organic inputs and infrastructure support to farmers.
full_description: The scheme "National Mission For Sustainable Agriculture-Parmparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (NMSA-PKVY)" is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme that aims to promote traditional and sustainable organic farming practices among farmers by providing financial support and infrastructure assistance. The scheme extends financial assistance for a maximum of 2 hectares per farmer for organic farming inputs, infrastructure development for on-farm organic input production, and related activities.
eligibility: The applicant should be a farmer.
The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.
benefits: **Financial Assistance:** Assistance is provided for a maximum of 2 hectares per farmer for inputs for organic farming, on-farm input production infrastructure, etc.

scheme_name: Whale Shark Conservation Programme
brief_description: The scheme aims to protect the endangered Whale Shark, the world's largest fish, along the Gujarat coast, a crucial breeding site. It mitigates threats from fishing by providing compensation for damaged nets and cultivates a strong conservation ethic among local fishermen and the broader public.
full_description: Launched in 2004, the "Whale Shark Conservation Programme" by the Forests and Environment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to tackle the problem of incidental catch and conserve the magnificent Whale Shark species, ensuring its protection along the Gujarat coast. The scheme provides full legal protection to Whale Sharks, listing them under Schedule-I of the Wildlife (Protection) Act, 1972 since May 28, 2001, marking it as the first fish protected by Indian law. It also features a compensation scheme for fishermen whose nets are damaged during rescue operations, and introduced a self-documentation process for claims in 2012. The fishermen must actively participate in rescue operations by reporting trapped Whale Sharks and assisting in their release. The scheme is implemented by the Forests and Environment Department. Applications for compensation under this scheme are accepted through reporting incidents to the forest range office or by self-documentation.
eligibility: The applicant must be a fisherman, particularly from the Kharva and Koli communities residing in the coastal talukas of Veraval, Sutrapada, and Mangrol in Junagadh district.
The applicant's fishing net must incur damage or require cutting during an operation to rescue a trapped Whale Shark.
The applicant, or the rescue team involved, must ensure the rescue operation is thoroughly documented through either videography or photography.

The applicant, under the self-documentation scheme, must photograph the trapped Whale Shark, release it on the spot, and then submit these photographs along with incident details to the Forests and Environment Department after returning to the sea coast.
benefits: > **Compensation for Damaged Nets**
Fishermen are paid compensation not exceeding ₹25,000/- (twenty-five thousand rupees) in lieu of nets that are damaged or cut during rescue operations involving trapped Whale Sharks.
> **Conditions for Benefit Availment/Disbursement**
The rescue operation must be documented through videography or photography for compensation to be paid.
The fishermen must take photographs of trapped Whale Sharks, release them on the spot, and then submit this information and photographs after returning to the coast to receive their compensation.

references.title: Mangroves Conservation And Whale Shark Protection
The Homecoming Of The Whale Shark

scheme_name: Assistance for Establishment of On farm Storage for Sorting-Grading
brief_description: The scheme "Assistance for Establishment of On-Farm Storage for Sorting-Grading" aims to prevent post-harvest spoilage in horticultural crops by providing financial assistance for constructing storage infrastructure and purchasing sorting-grading equipment for farmers across the state.
full_description: The scheme "Assistance for Establishment of On-Farm Storage for Sorting-Grading" by the Agriculture and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat aims to reduce post-harvest losses in horticultural crops and improve value addition by providing financial assistance to farmers for establishing on-farm infrastructure, including sorting, grading, packing, and primary value addition. The support includes both construction-related infrastructure and modern equipment/machinery for on-farm operations.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.
The applicant should be a farmer.
benefits: **For Construction of On-Farm Infrastructure:** Financial aid will be 50% of the unit cost or ₹1,50,000/- per unit, whichever is lower.- **For Machinery or Equipment Purchase:** Financial aid of 50% of the actual cost, subject to a maximum of ₹50,000/- per unit, whichever is less.

scheme_name: Assistance for Area Expansion of Vegetable Crops through Hybrid Seed
brief_description: The scheme "Assistance for Area Expansion of Vegetable Crops through Hybrid Seed" aims to promote natural farming and hybrid seed cultivation through financial assistance to farmers. The scheme provides up to ₹20,000 per hectare to encourage sustainable agricultural practices.
full_description: The scheme "Assistance for Area Expansion of Vegetable Crops through Hybrid Seed" by the Agriculture and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to support vegetable farmers in enhancing their cultivation areas using hybrid seeds and to promote natural farming practices. The financial assistance provided under the scheme helps reduce input costs and encourages environmentally sustainable agricultural methods among the farming community.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.
The applicant should be a farmer.
The applicant should be engaged in vegetable crop cultivation.
