benefits: 1. **Tin Boat-Net Unit:** 50% of unit cost or ₹7,500/- (Boat: ₹5,000/-; Net: ₹2,500/-), whichever is less.1. **F.R.P. (Fibre-Reinforced Plastic) Boat-Net Unit:** 50% of unit cost or ₹15,000/- (Boat: ₹12,500/-; Net: ₹2,500/-), whichever is less.
> **Conditions/Aspects/Criteria Associated:****** Benefit amount is calculated based on 50% of the unit cost or the fixed maximum amount mentioned above, whichever is less.
> **Minimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming Benefits:** 6 Years

scheme_name: Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries: Scheme For Fish Sale Equipment - Gujarat
brief_description: The scheme aims to increase fish production and provide employment to Scheduled Caste (SC) individuals engaged in inland fisheries. Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided for purchasing fish sale equipment to SC fish farmers and fishermen.
full_description: The scheme "Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries with the component scheme for Fish Sale Equipments, Gujarat" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to increase fish production and provide employment to Scheduled Caste (SC) individuals engaged in inland fisheries. Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided for purchasing fish sale equipment to SC fish farmers and fishermen. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries, Government of Gujarat. **Objectives:** - To increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to scheduled caste (SC) people involved in inland fisheries activities. - To boost fish farming or fishing activities in freshwater bodies by scheduled caste (SC) fish farmers and fishermen. - Fishing in reservoirs, aquaculture in ponds, and catch from rivers increase fish production and boost inland fisheries through scheduled caste (SC) fish farmers and fishermen. - The main objective is to provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Caste fishermen in the state and increase fish production.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) community.
1. The applicant should be above 18 years of age.
1. The applicant should be involved in inland fisheries activities.
1. The applicant can be an individual, a society, a self-help group, an association, a reservoir monopoly, or a private unit.
1. The applicant must have a bank account in their own name.
1. The applicant must have an Aadhar Card/Voter ID/Ration Card/Passport as proof of identity.
> **Preference/Reservation:**
The scheme specifically benefits Scheduled Caste fishermen under the inland fisheries scheme.
benefits: Assistance is provided at 50% of the total unit purchase cost of ₹15,000/-, which amounts to ₹7,500/-.
> **This assistance covers four components:**
An insulated box (₹1,000/-),
A renkadi (₹5,000/-),
A weighing unit (₹1,000/-).
> **Frequency of Disbursement:** This benefit can be availed once in a lifetime.

scheme_name: Akhil Bhartiya Kisan Mela and Krishi Udyog Pradarshani
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide a platform for farmers, agri-entrepreneurs, and stakeholders to access, learn about, and showcase the latest agricultural innovations, technologies, and practices.
full_description: The “Akhil Bhartiya Kisan Mela and Krishi Udyog Pradarshani” scheme is implemented by Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar, under the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide a platform for farmers, agri-entrepreneurs, and stakeholders to access, learn about, and showcase the latest agricultural innovations, technologies, and practices.
eligibility: 1. Participants should be farmers, farmer entrepreneurs, or agriculture-related firms interested in showcasing and promoting the latest agricultural technologies.
benefits: The Fair/Exhibition is organized twice a year on the university campus.

scheme_name: Construction of NABARD-Funded Minor Irrigation Projects - Uttarakhand
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide farmers with free and reliable irrigation facilities by constructing NABARD-funded minor irrigation projects, so that water availability improves and farming becomes easier and more productive.
full_description: The scheme “Construction of NABARD-Funded Minor Irrigation Projects” is implemented by the Department of Minor Irrigation, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide farmers with free and reliable irrigation facilities by constructing NABARD-funded minor irrigation projects, so that water availability improves and farming becomes easier and more productive.
eligibility: 1. The beneficiary must be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The beneficiary must be a farmer engaged in agricultural activities.
1. Under the scheme, collective irrigation projects are constructed.
1. Projects that are beneficial and essential, with a cost of ₹4.00 lakh per hectare and a benefit-cost ratio of more than 1.0, are included.
1. Check dams are constructed at suitable locations based on the proposals received and the survey conducted.
benefits: Under the scheme, farmers will be provided free irrigation facilities. The following works will be undertaken to provide irrigation facilities to the farmers under the scheme:
Solar Pump Irrigation Scheme
Pipeline / Water Channel (Gool)
Water Storage Tank / Geo-lined Tank
Construction of Check Dam (Hilly Areas)
Small Gated Weir (Plains Areas)

scheme_name: Rajya Dairy Udhyamita Vikas Yojna
brief_description: The "Rajya Dairy Udhyamita Vikas Yojna", under the Animal Husbandry Department of Chhattisgarh, aims to promote dairy entrepreneurship among youth. With the increasing demand for milk and dairy products, the scheme supports high-breed cow/buffalo rearing as a profitable business.
full_description:
the scheme "Male Pig Distribution Scheme" is an Animal Husbandry scheme by the Animal Husbandry Department, Government of Chhattisgarh, aims to promote dairy entrepreneurship among youth. With the increasing demand for milk and dairy products, the scheme supports high-breed cow/buffalo rearing as a profitable business.
**Objectives:** Encourage self-employment in the dairy sector. Boost dairy farming as an additional income source. Increase milk production and improve nutrition. Support the expansion of existing dairy units.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Chhattisgarh for at least five years.
1. The applicant should be purchase a maximum of two milch animals under the scheme.
1. The applicant should be entitled to 50% subsidy (up to ₹70,000/-) for general category and 66.6% subsidy (up to ₹93,200/-) for SC/ST category.
1. The applicant should be responsible for any additional costs beyond the scheme’s provisions, with no subsidy provided for the excess amount.
1. The applicant should ensure that the purchased animal is in milk production, not older than five years, and capable of producing at least 10 liters of milk per day at the time of purchase.
1. The applicant should have the animal insured for a minimum period of three years (total five years recommended) at the time of unit setup.

1. The applicant should be a landless, small or marginal farmer, BPL family member, milk co-operative society member, village resident on a milk collection route, Garva Yojana beneficiary, women SHG member, or an existing dairy farmer, as they will receive priority.
1. The applicant should be the only eligible beneficiary from a joint family.
1. The applicant should not own at least two high-breed dairy animals at the time of applying for the scheme.
benefits: **Dairy Unit Grant Details**
**1. Financial Assistance for Dairy Units**

**Eligible Animals:** Indian dairy breeds (Sahiwal, Red Sindhi, Gir, Tharparkar, etc.), advanced crossbreed cows, and high-breed buffaloes.- **Maximum Limit:** Financial support for up to two milch animals.- **Total Finance Cost:** ₹1,40,000/- (₹70,000/- per animal, including three years of insurance).
**2. Subsidy Details**
**For General Category Beneficiaries:**
50% subsidy on the actual cost, up to ₹70,000/- per unit.
For SC/ST Beneficiaries: 66.6% subsidy, up to ₹93,200/- per unit.
**Note:** Unit cost per animal is based on the Government of India’s guidelines (Letter No. F 1-1/2009-DP, dated 02 May 2018).

scheme_name: State Goat Entrepreneurship Development Scheme
brief_description: The "State Goat Entrepreneurship Development Scheme", initiated by the Animal Husbandry Department of Chhattisgarh, aims to promote goat farming as a sustainable livelihood option. Goat rearing has been a traditional occupation, and with increasing demand for milk and meat.
full_description:
The "State Goat Entrepreneurship Development Scheme" is an Animal Husbandry scheme by the Animal Husbandry Department, Government of Chhattisgarh, which aims to promote goat farming as a sustainable livelihood option. Goat rearing has been a traditional occupation, and with increasing demand for milk and meat, advanced goat farming presents a profitable self-employment opportunity in rural areas.
**Objectives** - To boost the supply of milk and meat through organized goat farming. - To provide an additional source of income for rural households. - To offer technical and financial support for setting up goat farming units.
**Key Features** - Low Investment, High Returns: Goat farming requires minimal investment but yields significant income. - **Nutritional Benefits:** Goat milk is highly nutritious and easily digestible, making it ideal for children and patients.- **High-Quality Meat:** Goat meat is rich in protein and has high market demand.- **Fast Breeding Rate:** Goats have a short reproductive cycle and can produce multiple offspring.- **Drought Resilience:** Goats can survive in harsh conditions, making them a reliable source of income even during droughts.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Chhattisgarh for at least five years.
1. The applicant should be linked to a loan from a Nationalized, Cooperative, or Regional Rural Bank.
1. The applicant should be willing to sign a contract with the department to operate the unit for at least three years.
1. The applicant should be eligible for the grant only after obtaining the Unit Establishment Verification Certificate, a demand letter from the bank, and submitting necessary documents.
1. The applicant should be the only person from a joint family applying for the grant.
1. The applicant should be aware that a joint family receiving benefits under the scheme cannot reapply for the next five years.
benefits: **Financial Assistance Under the State Goat Entrepreneurship Development Scheme**

**Total finance cost:** ₹1,00,000/- per goat unit (30 goats + 2 improved breed goats).- **For general category beneficiaries:** 25% subsidy on the total cost, up to a maximum of ₹₹25,000/-- **For SC/ST beneficiaries:** 33.3% subsidy on the total cost, up to a maximum of ₹33,300/-.

scheme_name: Assistance to Farmers in Purchasing Nano Fertilizers Under the Agricultural Assistance Program for Farmers Other than Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes
brief_description: This scheme offers financial assistance to farmers from non-SC/ST categories to support the purchase of Nano Fertilizers, aiming to enhance agricultural productivity and uplift the standard of living of farmers in Gujarat.
full_description: The scheme &quot;Assistance to Farmers in Purchasing Nano Fertilizers Under the Agricultural Assistance Program for Farmers Other than Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial aid to non-SC/ST farmers in Gujarat to help them purchase Nano Fertilizers. By encouraging the use of efficient and innovative agricultural inputs, the scheme strives to boost farm productivity, improve crop yields, and raise the overall economic well-being of farmers.
eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer.
The applicant must belong to the General category (i.e., not SC or ST).
The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
benefits: Up to 50% of the purchased price per hectare or ₹750/- (within a maximum limit of 4 hectares per account.

scheme_name: PMMSY: Establishment of large RAS / Biofloc culture system - Haryana
brief_description: The scheme provides capital assistance for setting up large-scale Recirculatory Aquaculture Systems (RAS) and Biofloc culture systems to promote high-yield, sustainable fish farming.
full_description: The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Establishment of Large RAS / Biofloc Culture System, introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide capital assistance for setting up large-scale Recirculatory Aquaculture Systems (RAS) and Biofloc culture systems to promote high-yield, sustainable fish farming. It is a centrally funded scheme with a 50:50 cost-sharing pattern between the Central and State Governments. - For RAS: A minimum of 8 tanks of 90 m³ each (capacity: 40 tons/crop).- For Biofloc: 50 tanks of 4 m diameter and 1.5 m height. The scheme encourages the adoption of modern aquaculture infrastructure, particularly by trained and certified individuals. It offers enhanced subsidy support for SC and Women beneficiaries, aiming to boost inclusive and sustainable fish farming practices.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Haryana and possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
1. The applicant must belong to either the General, Scheduled Caste (SC), or Women category.
1. The applicant must be the owner or legal leaseholder (with a minimum 10-year lease) of the land intended for setting up the unit.
1. The applicant must have access to either surface water or groundwater for aquaculture purposes.
1. The applicant must hold a valid training certificate in fisheries or aquaculture.
1. The applicant must be willing to maintain and operate the unit at personal cost after the initial setup.
1. The applicant must submit a complete Detailed Project Report (DPR) or a Self-Contained Proposal (SCP) for evaluation.
1. The applicant must agree to sign an official agreement with the Fisheries Department to avail of benefits under the scheme.
benefits: The project cost is ₹50,00,000/
> **RAS (Recirculating Aquaculture System) Subsidy:**
1. A 20% subsidy is available for the General Category.
1. A 25% subsidy is offered for SC (Scheduled Caste) and Women beneficiaries.
> **Biofloc Subsidy:**
1. A 40% subsidy is available for the General Category.
1. A 60% subsidy is offered for SC (Scheduled Caste) and Women beneficiaries.

scheme_name: PMMSY: Establishment of small RAS /Biofloc culture system - Haryana
brief_description: The scheme provides capital assistance for setting up small-scale Recirculatory Aquaculture Systems (RAS) and Biofloc culture systems to promote high-yield, sustainable fish farming.
full_description: The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Establishment of small RAS / Biofloc Culture System, introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide  financial assistance for establishing small-scale aquaculture units, either through 1 RAS tank (100 m³ capacity) or 7 Biofloc tanks (4 m diameter × 1.5 m height). It aims to promote sustainable and scientific fish farming for individual farmers with smaller land or capital access. It is a centrally funded scheme with a 50:50 cost-sharing pattern between the Central and State Governments.
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Haryana and possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
1. The applicant must own land or have a registered lease of at least 10 years, free from legal encumbrances.
1. The applicant must have access to a water source such as a canal, well, tube well, or similar.
1. The applicant must be trained in aquaculture or fisheries and hold a valid certification.
1. The applicant must be willing to maintain and operate the system at their own cost post-installation.
1. The applicant must submit a Detailed Project Report (DPR) or a Self-Contained Proposal (SCP).
1. The applicant must sign an agreement with the Fisheries Department to be eligible under the scheme.
benefits: The project cost is ₹7,50,000/
> **Subsidy Distribution:**
A 40% subsidy is available for the General Category.
A 60% subsidy is offered for SC (Scheduled Caste) and Women beneficiaries.

scheme_name: Intensive Fisheries Development Programme - Subsidy on Purchase of Fishing Nets (Scheduled Caste)
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to individuals from Scheduled Caste families engaged in fishing activities for the purchase of fishing nets. Under this scheme, a 60% subsidy or up to ₹24,000, on the purchase of fishing nets worth ₹40,000/- will be provided to eligible beneficiaries.
full_description: The &quot;Subsidy on Purchase of Fishing Nets&quot; is a scheme component under the Intensive Fisheries Development Programme, introduced by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to individuals from Scheduled Caste families engaged in fishing activities for the purchase of fishing nets. Under this scheme, eligible beneficiaries can avail a subsidy of up to 60% on the cost of fishing nets.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
1. The applicant should possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category.
1. The applicant should be at least 18 years old.
1. The applicant should present a GST-paid bill for the purchase of fishing nets.
1. The applicant can apply only once in two years for this subsidy.
benefits: **Financial Assistance is provided to Fish Farmers under the scheme:**
Financial assistance of 60% subsidy on the purchase of fishing nets of amounting to ₹40,000/-.
The maximum subsidy amount is ₹24,000/-.
> **Note:** Subsidy is available only once in two years per beneficiary.

scheme_name: Distribution of Horticulture Kit to Urban and Rural Areas
brief_description: Through this scheme, all the horticulture growers in rural & urban areas are provided with a horticulture kit worth ₹ 3,000 per kit to urban and rural areas, during Aadipattam/Thaipattam, through the Additional Director of Agriculture (Horticulture).
full_description: The scheme “Distribution of Horticulture Kit to Urban and Rural Areas" was launched by the Department of Agriculture and Farmer's Welfare, Union Territory of Puducherry. Through this scheme, all the horticulture growers in rural & urban areas are provided with a horticulture kit worth ₹ 3,000 per kit to urban and rural areas, during Aadipattam/Thaipattam, through the Additional Director of Agriculture (Horticulture).
eligibility: All horticulture growers of rural & urban areas are eligible.
benefits: 75% subsidy, i.e. distribution of horticulture kit worth ₹ 3,000 per kit to urban and rural areas (homestead/backyards), through the Additional Director of Agriculture (Horticulture), during Aadipattam/Thaipattam seasonality.

scheme_name: Paddy Transplantor Machine se Dhan Ropayee par Anudan
brief_description: The scheme aims to promote mechanized paddy transplantation under the Agriculture Development and Farmer Welfare and Biotechnology Department, Chhattisgarh. It provides ₹3,000 per acre for land preparation, including ploughing and weeding, up to 2 hectares.
full_description:
The scheme was launched on December 26, 2014, The Paddy Transplanter Machine Se Dhan Ropayee Par Anudan, under the Agriculture Development and Farmer Welfare and Biotechnology Department, Chhattisgarh. The scheme aims to promote paddy transplantation using advanced technology, expand the area under transplantation, and improve efficiency in rice cultivation.
The scheme is applicable across the entire state, benefiting farmers by providing financial assistance for land preparation. A grant of ₹3,000 per acre will be given for activities such as ploughing and weeding, up to a maximum limit of 2 hectares. This assistance covers the preparation of a mat-type nursery and the transplantation of paddy using a paddy transplanter machine, ensuring improved efficiency and higher yields.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a farmer residing in the Chhattisgarh.
1. The applicant should be engaged in paddy cultivation.
1. The applicant should be willing to use a paddy transplanter machine for transplantation.
1. The applicant should be preparing a mat-type nursery for paddy transplantation.
1. The applicant should have suitable land for ploughing and weeding.
1. The applicant should have a cultivable area of up to 2 hectares to be eligible for the grant.
benefits: **(A) Field Preparation Expenditure per Hectare:**
Field Ploughing (5 hours @ ₹700 per hour): ₹3,500/
Field Weeding (6 hours with Rotavator @ ₹700 per hour): ₹4,200/
Total Field Preparation Cost: ₹7,700/
**(B) Expenditure for Seedling Preparation per Hectare:**
Plastic Sheet for Nursery (15 Kg @ ₹100 per Kg): ₹1,500/
Field Weeding (6 hours with Rotavator @ ₹500 per hour): ₹3,000/
Other Expenses (Soil, Manure, Sand, Water - arranged by the farmer): Not Included
Additional Contingencies: ₹500/
Total Seedling Preparation Cost: ₹5,000/
**Total Expenditure per Hectare:**
Field Preparation (A) + Seedling Preparation (B): ₹7,700 + ₹5,000 = ₹12,500/- per hectare
Cost per Acre: ₹5,080/
**Subsidy Details:**
Subsidy Amount: 75% of the cost
Maximum Subsidy Limit: ₹3,800/- per acre

scheme_name: Male Pig Distribution Scheme
brief_description: The "Male Pig Distribution Scheme", under the Animal Husbandry Department, Government of  Chhattisgarh, provides a grant to beneficiaries from the SC/ST category for purchasing one male pig of an improved breed (Middle White Yorkshire).
full_description:
The "Male Pig Distribution Scheme", implemented by the Animal Husbandry Department, Government of Chhattisgarh, provides financial assistance to beneficiaries from the Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) categories for purchasing one male pig of an improved breed (Middle White Yorkshire).
The beneficiary can purchase one breeding male pig of Middle White Yorkshire breed, aged 6 months to 1 year, from a government pig rearing project or locally.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe category.
1. The applicant should be a resident of Chhattisgarh.
1. The beneficiary should purchase a male pig of the improved breed (Middle White Yorkshire).
1. The pig should be between the 6th months the 1st year of age.
1. The purchase should be made from a Government-rearing project or a local authorized source.
benefits: 90% of the unit cost (purchase price) or a maximum subsidy of ₹3,500/-, whichever is lower (for Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST)  category).

scheme_name: Chief Minister Sustainable Agriculture Irrigation Scheme - Magel Tyala Shettale (Individual Farm Pond)
short_name: CHIEF MINISTER SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE IRRIGATION SCHEME
brief_description: Under this scheme subsidy payable to individual farmer is minimum Rs.14433/- and maximum Rs.75000/- depending on the size of the farm pond.
full_description:
Chief Minister Sustainable Agriculture Irrigation Scheme-Magel Tyala Shettale (Individual Farm Pond) has been launched by Ministry of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry, Dairy Development &amp; Fishries Department, Maharashtra State in the year 2022-23 (vide G.R. Dated 29 th June, 2022)
Under this scheme subsidy payable to individual farmer is minimum Rs.14433/- and maximum Rs.75000/- depending on the size of the farm pond.
<br>

Out of total area, 82 percent area of agriculture land in the state is rainfed and is dependent on rainfall. Water stress due to uneven distribution of rains and periodic interruptions in rains leads to large reduction in crop production. Sometimes crops are also destroyed. Farm ponds, in such situation plays an important role in providing protective irrigation and reduces crop losses substantially. Considering this matter, Chief Minister Sustainable Agriculture Irrigation Scheme-Individual Farm Pond has been sanctioned by the Maharashtra State Govt. vide G.R. Dated 29th June,2022.
The scheme is implemented in all districts of the state. Under this scheme the subsidy payable to individual farmer is minimum Rs 14433/- and maximum Rs 75000/- depending on the size of the farm pond. Farmers should hold at least 0.20 ha land in Kokan region, while it is 0.40 ha limit for rest of the Maharashtra. Online applications are invited from farmers under Maha-DBT portal. The scheme is implemented by selecting the beneficiaries online through Maha-DBT portal.
After completion of the farm pond, the subsidy payable under the scheme is credited through the PFMS system to theAadhaar number linked bank account of the farmer. The farm ponds are of two types one being with inlet outlet and the other without inlet and outlet type.
The implementation of the component &quot;Magel TyalaShettale&quot; under Chief Minister Sustainable Agriculture Irrigation Scheme was approved videGovernment Circular dated April 25,2023. 
The name “Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Krishi Yojana&quot; was given vide GR. dated 18th October 2023.
eligibility: 1) Farmer should hold at least (Minimum) 0.20 ha. land and Kokan region, while it is 0.40 ha. limit for rest of Maharashtra.

2) The applicant farmers land will have to be technically suitable for digging farm pond. So that the runoff rainwater can be stored in the farm pond through natural flow and recharge will be possible. In case of farm ponds without inlet and outlet there should be a natural source from where extra runoff during rainy season can be lifted and stored in farm pond.
3) Before applying for farm pond, the applicant farmers should not have availed the subsidy for farm pond, community tank or bodi in paddy bunding or any Government Scheme.
benefits: 1) Financial Assistance is given to farmers.
2)The subsidy payable to an individual farmer minimum Rs.14433/- and maximum Rs.75000/- depending on the size of the farm pond.
exclusions: Farmers who have availed the subsidy for farm pond, community tank or bodi in paddy bunding under any Government Scheme previously is not eligible for subsidy again.

references.title: Chief Minister Sustainable Agriculture Irrigation Scheme GR

scheme_name: Intensive Fisheries Development Programme - Subsidy on Commercial Four-Wheeler Vehicles
brief_description: The scheme aims to strengthen the fisheries value chain by providing transportation support to fish farmers. Under this scheme, eligible fish farmers receive a subsidy of 25% of the actual cost on the purchase of a commercial four-wheeler vehicle used for fisheries-related activities.
full_description: The &quot;Subsidy on Commercial Four-Wheeler Vehicles&quot; is a scheme component under the Intensive Fisheries Development Programme, implemented by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. The scheme aims to strengthen the fisheries value chain by providing transportation support to fish farmers. Under this scheme, eligible fish farmers receive a subsidy of 25% of the actual cost on the purchase of a commercial four-wheeler vehicle used for fisheries-related activities.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
1. The applicant should possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
1. The applicant should be at least 18 years of age.
benefits: Subsidy under the scheme is provided at the rate of 25% of the actual cost of the four-wheeler (₹9 lakh) or ₹2.25 lakh, whichever is lower.
exclusions: 1. The applicant should not be employed in any government or semi-government institution/organization.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Refrigerated Vehicles – Haryana
brief_description: The scheme aims to enhance cold chain infrastructure & ensure hygienic and efficient fish transportation. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to fishers for purchasing refrigerated vehicles to maintain the freshness & quality of fish during post-harvest handling & transportation.
full_description: The “Refrigerated Vehicles” is a scheme component under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY), implemented by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. This is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme, aims to enhance cold chain infrastructure and ensure hygienic and efficient fish transportation. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to fishers for purchasing refrigerated vehicles to maintain the freshness and quality of fish during post-harvest handling and transportation.
eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Haryana.
1. The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra.
1. The applicant should ensure that the refrigerated vehicle remains operational for fish transportation.
1. The applicant will be eligible for a subsidy for the purchase of only one refrigerated vehicle.
1. The applicant should utilize the refrigerated vehicle solely for fishery-related transportation activities.
1. The Government of India and the Government of Haryana will not be responsible for any loss incurred in the purchase, operation, maintenance, and management of fish transport facilities.
benefits: **Financial Assistance provided under the scheme:**
Project Cost: ₹25,00,000/- per unit
Subsidy will be limited to 40% of the project cost for the General Category of beneficiaries.
Subsidy will be limited to 60% of the project cost for Weaker sections/Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe/Women and their co-operatives of beneficiaries.

scheme_name: Development Support for Coffee in Traditional Areas, Non-Traditional Area and North Eastern Region : Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs)
short_name: DEVELOPMENT SUPPORT FOR COFFEE FARMERS PRODUCER ORGANIZATIONS (FPOS)
brief_description: To provide broad-based supportive ecosystem to facilitate development of vibrant, socially and economically sustainable coffee communities.
full_description:
- To provide broad-based supportive ecosystem to facilitate development of vibrant, socially and economically sustainable coffee communities.


  - To enhance productivity and reduce cost of cultivation through cost effective, sustainable and efficient use of resources and realize higher returns by direct market linkages for their produce through collective action.


  - Capacity building of FPOs to develop entrepreneurship skills to climb up the value chain to attain self-sustainability.
eligibility: General FPO; shall have a minimum 100 coffee growers as members.

FPOs / FPCs shall have Memorandum of Association, Bye-laws, and Administrative Committees and shall be registered under part IXA of companies Act or under Co-operative Societies Act of the concerned states.
The FPO shall be in existence for at least two years and with sound finances as per audit report.
benefits: **Broad Services and Activities of FPO**
The FPO may create the following common infrastructural facilities for which the Board will extend subsidy
Sprinkler unit,
Drying yard/ mechanical drier/ solar tunnel drier
Go down,
Eco-pulper
Custom hiring centers for machineries
Nursery for production of planting material.
These facilities shall be permitted to be used by its members or other coffee growers by collecting user charges, which will be used for maintenance.
Eco-certification / organic / Natural farming.
Establishment of Roasting &amp; Grinding unit
Supply quality inputs like seed, fertilizer, Bio control agents, etc. at reasonable prices.
Create infrastructure for value addition like cleaning, sorting, grading, packing, branding by collecting user charges or by collectivization to secure better returns.
Facilitate market information for judicious decision in production and marketing
Collective marketing of produce to secure better and remunerative prices
Facilitate logistics services such as storage, transportation etc.

scheme_name: PMMSY: Establishment of Medium RAS / Biofloc culture system - Haryana
brief_description: The scheme provides capital assistance to fish farmers and entrepreneurs for establishing medium-scale Recirculatory Aquaculture Systems (RAS) and Biofloc systems.
full_description:
The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Establishment of Medium RAS / Biofloc Culture System,  introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide capital assistance to fish farmers and entrepreneurs for establishing medium-scale Recirculatory Aquaculture Systems (RAS) and Biofloc systems. These models promote high-density fish production in controlled environments, significantly reducing land and water usage. It is a centrally funded scheme with a 50:50 cost-sharing pattern between the Central and State Governments.

- For RAS: Minimum 6 tanks of 30 m³ each (10 tons/crop)- For Biofloc: 25 tanks of 4 m diameter and 1 m height
eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Haryana and possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
1. The applicant must have access to own land or hold a registered lease for a minimum period of 10 years.
1. The applicant must ensure that the land is free from any legal and financial encumbrances.
1. The applicant must have access to a reliable water source such as a canal, tube well, river, or similar.
1. The applicant must provide a valid training certificate in fisheries or aquaculture.
1. The applicant must agree to manage and maintain the system at their own cost after setup.
1. The applicant must submit a Detailed Project Report (DPR) or a Self-Contained Proposal (SCP).
1. The applicant must sign an agreement with the Department of Fisheries to avail benefits under the scheme.
benefits: The project cost is ₹25,00,000/
> **** **Subsidy Distribution:**
1. 40% subsidy for General Category beneficiaries.
1. 60% subsidy for SC and Women category beneficiaries.
